betterquesting.name: For The Memory Of A Lifetime
betterquesting.desc: **Charge the teleportorium to receive a recall beacon** -By juicing the teleportorium up you can keep your recall beacon functioning well past it's intended lifespan. It's much cheaper than the emergency teleport function, so keeping it on hand might be prudent.

betterquesting.name: Welcome Home
betterquesting.desc: **Use your recall beacon to scan for and connect to a teleporter network.** -Where there's orbitals, there's teleportoriums. You can use your recall beacon to look for one to hook up to. If you find one, you can use it to escape death, assuming it's operational.

betterquesting.name: Stay Frosty
betterquesting.desc: **Put your flak armor on and submit your booze barrel** -Approaching the planet at high speeds and preoccupied with self-pity, you never saw the defense orbital bristling with lance and missile batteries train it's sights on you. The first salvo almost hit the warp core, but missed and cut into the reactor instead. Pushing the old ship to its limits, dodging white-hot las fire, and rapidly losing reactor stability, you're barely able to keep the thing from blowing apart as you punch through the planets atmosphere. Skimming across the clouds, your reactor finally reaches its limit and explodes, sending chunks of the ship sailing off in different directions. Nestled in the cockpit, you arc through the air and come skidding to a halt, canyons all around you. You're lucky to be alive. You strain your eyes and crack your back, eliciting a crescendo of popping bones. The sun beating down on you is making you pour sweat and it feels like it must be over 120 degrees, at least. This planet is a death world, no doubt about it. As the ringing in your ears subsides and the world comes into focus again you feel your hands shaking. The wreck and the whole situation has got your nerves on edge, and you could really go for a drink. Right now.

betterquesting.name: In Transit
betterquesting.desc: **Open your cogitator and review your character sheet. Complete the quest "You're SPECIAL". Complete the quests it unlocks and then assign your stat, trait and skill points as you see fit. When you're done, go to the cockpit to make your approach on Mortua.** -"It's been a long journey, and I need to stretch out and re-orient myself before I head down to the surface."

betterquesting.name: Wired
betterquesting.desc: **Gather the materials for various types of wire.** -"Wire comes in two types: the stringy sort that you stretch between two wire connectors, and the blocky sort which you place block by block. There are some situations where you can't use the block wire, but you can always use the stringy type. You may find that different types are more or less convenient for different situations, so use them at your discretion. Finally, keep in mind that the two types are interchangeable; it's simple to swap between them, so check the recipes."

betterquesting.name: Worm In
betterquesting.desc: **Use Roach's worm on the Ad-Mech mainframe.** -Whether or not some scruffy civilian is able to outwit the Ad-Mech remains to be seen, but it seems that given the circumstances you have little choice. Roach writes that all you have to do to obtain the data is send the worm via a small cable you can attach to your cogitator. The catch is that you'll have to be very close to the mainframe for it to work.

betterquesting.name: Eternal Darkness
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with Burke.** -Having learned the truth of who you are and the past that you were denied you feel compelled to seek revenge on those who wronged you. Your hatred for the officials that held you back, the aristocrats who subverted your work, and finally for the Inquisition, for depriving you of yourself, grow by the hour. You find yourself cursing the galaxy, and in your heart you know the Emperor has abandoned you. They will all pay, and Burke can help you.

betterquesting.name: High-Tech Low-Life
betterquesting.desc: **Gather the materials to build a Chemical Processor Mk.II, otherwise known as a Thermal Centrifuge.** -"The Thermal Centrifuge is an amalgam of dozens of different machines. It was likely developed by the Mortuans at their zenith, because it can do just about anything, chemically speaking. In this case, I'm suggesting you build it for it's ability to stretch out your ore supplies even further, but it can do so much more. You'll probably find yourself needing several of these, even with overclockers. The one drawback is that these machines require powerful computing hardware, which means you'll need huge quartz crystals. You can find the crystals in areas where there's been volcanic activity. I know of one such location nearby, but I can't guarantee you'll find any there."

betterquesting.name: Aqua Cola
betterquesting.desc: **Construct empty cells, locate the water pump, and gather the materials for a Material Washer.** -"This next task involves locating the water pump, so get your gear on and get ready to go back out into the wasteland. The pump was set up to pull water from deep within Mortua's crust to the surface. It's the best place to stock up on water in large volumes. Before you can even collect water you should build some cells. They're small, one use containers that can hold just about any liquid. They're also fairly cheap, but I wouldn't make them out of anything but steel unless I was in a pinch. The Material Washer will let you exchange water and power for a marginal boost in ore gain. You'll also get some ore byproducts that may prove useful, but the trade off does not favor those that value their time. I doubt you'll be making frequent trips to restock water, but if you can manage to manufacture it, washing your ore can stretch it much further."

betterquesting.name: Cult Of The Machine
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with CS-16, the combat servitor.** -In the corner of the modest bunker stands a solemn simulacrum; a combat servitor. It's hulking, mechanical form is a fusion of flesh and steel. Servitors themselves are either mind-wiped criminals or vat-grown clones, and they exist only to serve their masters. This one is outfitted for combat, and based off it's markings you immediately recognize the handiwork of the Adeptus Mechanicus, or Ad-mech. You have no choice but to attempt to engage it in conversation.

betterquesting.name: Stretched Supplies
betterquesting.desc: **Gather the materials to build a Material Processor Mk. I, otherwise known as a Macerator, and a Electric Furnace Mk. I.** -"A Macerator will double your ore output. Just plop it down, run some power to it and throw your ore in. It will give you two crushed ore for every normal ore, which can be smelted or further processed in the ore washer and/or the thermal centrifuge. The Electric Furnace uses electricity to efficiently smelt ore. It's a big upgrade from the stone furnace."

betterquesting.name: You Know The Drill
betterquesting.desc: **Gather the materials for two mining drills** -"I'm sure your trusty steel tools have served you well, but it's time to take it to the next level. Gather me the materials for two drills; you'll be using one for your self and another will be set aside for another project. Once you've completed your task, it wouldn't be a bad idea to upgrade the drills to their mark two versions. Those things will mine faster than steel tools, and if you wear the batt-pack while you're using it you won't have to stop to juice it up for quite a while."

betterquesting.name: An Indestructible Object
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain adamantium plates.** -"You may believe that a ship with shields doesn't need armor, but you'd be wrong. Shields are complex and prone to buggy behavior or outright failure. In the warp, a battle, or a micro-meteor storm this almost certainly means that you'll become ground meat with adaquate armor plating. Adamantium plating is strong enough to withstand the tremendous forces of Daemon claws, lascannon beams, and space debris. You can thank me later."

betterquesting.name: Warped Sense Of Reality
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain warp beacons. They can be found in the large towers scattered across the planet.** -"The warp beacons acted like network hubs for the guidance relays. Aside from their duty to tie the network together, they also projected a beam of light into the warp which could be seen by navigators who were close enough. I think I can reconfigure the beacons to reverse their function and project warp-space on real-space, thus giving you warp shields."

betterquesting.name: Course Correction
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain navigation relays. They can be found in the large towers scattered across the planet.** -"Navigation relays contain extremely detailed starmaps, to the point of being able to predict the optimum currents to follow through the warp to reach your intended target. Since the Astronomicon often proves unreliable in this part of space, I recommend obtaining a few of these to fill in the blank spots and keep you on course."

betterquesting.name: Command And Conquer
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain mk.I computers.** -"A spacecraft will need a lot more computing power than you can pack in a few circuits. You will need at least three Mk.I Computers for this. Don't get cheap on me now, Commissar."

betterquesting.name: Operation Orion
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain a nuclear reactor, fuel and coolant.** -"Right now the most space efficient form of power generation we have access to is the nuclear reactor. The energy dense fuel and high output will allow you to travel faster and further than if you used anything else."

betterquesting.name: Engine Check
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain huge thrusters.** -"You'll need some kind of basic thrusters to get off the planet and manuever outside of the Warp. The standard plasma thruster template should do."

betterquesting.name: Into The Void
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain guidance relays. They can be found on small towers and some civilian buildings.** -"The relays are a crude combination of cogitator and some arcane warp device that was only partially understood. They were originally built to facilitate mining operations in some of the nearby systems. Once arranged in large arrays across the planet, they were able to act as a miniature Astronomicon, guiding our ships safely through the fluctuating warp currents surrounding Mortua. Now, I think I can put some of them to use again as spare parts for your warp drive and Gellar field."

betterquesting.name: Environmental Hazard
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain life-support systems.** -"The life-support systems will provide you with fresh air. Necessary unless you plan on keeping a suit on the entire time."

betterquesting.name: Space Oddities
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain various components.** -"A spacecraft is a large, complex machine, so you're going to need some odds and ends. Motors, wiring, circuits, and so on. On top of that, you'll need a mountain of Dust to put this all together, otherwise we' be working on it for years."

betterquesting.name: Everything In It's Place
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain structural blocks.** -"Once you finally have all your sub-systems ready, it's time to assemble the ships superstructure. Don't worry about setting up the sub-systems, you can integrate them into the structure afterwards quite easily thanks to the Dust."

betterquesting.name: All Systems Go
betterquesting.desc: **Talk to Endel.** -"Once you have all the components ready, come see me."

betterquesting.name: Know Your Enemy
betterquesting.desc: **Locate Burke's forces.** -From the sounds of it the only real threat on Mortua aside from the local fauna are the forces that aligned with Burke during the civil war, and perhaps Burke herself. If you are to fulfill your mission, the remnants will need to be brought into Imperial compliance by any means necessary, and Burke's command will need to be terminated with extreme prejudice.

betterquesting.name: Reunited
betterquesting.desc: **Locate what remains of the Imperial presence.** -Thanks to Endel you finally have a solid lead on the whereabouts of the Imperial survivors. Making contact with them will almost certainly lead to more trouble for you, but it feels like the right thing to do now that you know they're still alive.

betterquesting.name: Alternative Signals
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the source of the signal emanating from the strange dune.** -While conducting scans of the planet a strange electronic signature was detected. It seemed to be just beyond the capacity of the ships cogitator to process the signal, and the source of it was an unusually tall but otherwise nondescript sand dune. As if that wasn't strange enough, the cogitators readout repeatedly printed the numbers 8219 for several hundred lines before moving on to the next object. Perhaps there's someone, or something, that can provide assistance there.

betterquesting.name: Alternative Energies
betterquesting.desc: **Gather the materials to build renewable energy sources.** -"I'm sure your trusty steel tools have served you well, but it's time to move on. Gather me the materials for two drills; you'll be using one for your self and another will be set aside for another project. Once you've completed your task, it wouldn't be a bad idea to upgrade the drills to their mark two versions. Those things will mine faster than steel tools, and if you wear the batt-pack while you're using it you won't have to stop to juice it up for quite a while."

betterquesting.name: Post-Scarcity
betterquesting.desc: **Gather the materials for an auto-miner.** -"I'm sure that by now you're getting pretty tired of those caves, what with the hazardous work environment and all. If that's the case, then I have some great news for you - for but a small capital investment you can build auto-miners to do all that hard labor for you. They operate by feeding a lattice into the ground and using it to excavate ores and minerals, which are then brought up to the surface and deposited in an attached chest for collection. You'll need a few things to get the rig working: the auto-miner itself, the mining lattice, a drill and an ore detector. The auto-miner is self explanatory, and the mining lattices are placed inside it along with the drill and ore detector. The better the drill, the faster it mines. The better the detector, the bigger the area it mines out. The miner will only target economically viable ores, though, so if you just want to excavate a large area you may be better off with mining explosives. Get me the materials and I'll assemble a rig for you. Once you have one, it's only a matter of time before you can afford to build another, and so on."

betterquesting.name: Too Many Items
betterquesting.desc: **Gather the materials for a simple auto-sorting system.** -"I'm sure you're already up to your neck in materials of all shapes and sizes, with little to do with them but stuff them some chests. Pretty soon your base is a cluttered mess of chests stuffed with things that you can never locate, and that's just not any way to live. The simplest solution to sorting your things involves two things: caches and pressure pipes. Caches can hold huge quantities of a single item, and pressure pipes will deposit items in the first available container. So simply set up caches to store what you want, attach pressure pipes and start pumping things into them. It will then makes its way to the correct cache for later retrievel. You'll also need an item importer to pump things out of a chest and into the pipes, and a timer to activate the item importer. Just in case you pump something into the system that won't go in any cache, you'll place a pressure resistance tube attached to a chest somewhere along the line. That way, if an item can't go anywhere else it will eventually go in that chest."

betterquesting.name: Strike The Earth
betterquesting.desc: **Gather materials to build mining equipment.** -Endel seems to be genuinely concerned with your well-being. Though it's his duty to assist with your investigation, you suspect he has ulterior motives. Regardless, his advice is sound, and he's even expressed a desire to help you establish a base of operations on Mortua. He's recorded a series of short lessons and even offered to fabricate some essentials for you, provided you supply the materials. You feel compelled to listen. "Before you begin your investigation, you're probably going to want to establish a base of operations. Someplace secure, where you can stash your supplies and rest without much interference. Unless you can find an abandoned bunker that you can re-purpose, I'd recommend seeking high ground. The mesas in particular seem to be largely avoided by the entities, and are defensible positions. You'll probably have to do some excavating, and you'll definitely need some mining tools for later, so let's start there. Steel hand tools are fine for now, and steel picks are even comparable to your basic drill when it comes to mining speed. Just make sure to melt it down before there's nothing left but handle, that way you can forge yourself a new one with the steel you get back. Get me some steel parts and some wood and I'll give you a decent pick and shovel to start with. You can salvage steel parts from the remains of the more cybernetic-looking creatures, and the scrawny creosote trees that dot the wasteland aren't a bad source of wood."

betterquesting.name: Instant Arsenal
betterquesting.desc: **Gather the materials for machinery to build weapons.** -"Now that you've established an economy of sorts, I think it's time for you to build up your weapon and ammo stores. The easiest way to do it, aside from just buying them, is by fabricating them yourself. The process is somewhat simplified with the aid of a set of standardized tools and blueprints that we've recovered here on Mortua. All you'll need is the benches and a few basic inputs, which you should have in your inventory while using the bench. After that, you simply make your selection and receive the item. Easy, right? You know the drill: get me the materials and I'll get you the benches."

betterquesting.name: How The Mighty Fall: EU
betterquesting.desc: **You have a set number of lives and if you lose them all you'll be locked out of the map. To gain more lives you must submit a charged Batt-Pack Mk.II.** -You are now registered with the teleportorium. If you're near death you'll be teleported to safety, retaining your belongings. However, this costs the teleportorium quite a bit of energy; energy that has to be replaced. If the energy isn't replaced you'll be allowed to die, locking you out of the map. To keep it charged you submit a charged Batt-Pack Mk.II through this quest. Your Batt-Pack will be returned, empty, alongside another item: the Acknowledge Network Prompt item - use it immediately to gain another life. Your lives are listed on the front page of your Cogitator. Keep in mind that a Batt-Pack Mk.II needs charged in a Batt-Box Mk.II at the least, and that a Batt-Box Mk.II can be charged by any generator. You start with ten lives, so use those lives wisely and focus on getting a Generator, Batt-Pack Mk.II, Batt-Box Mk.II and some fuel as soon as possible. Good luck!

betterquesting.name: Staying Alive
betterquesting.desc: **Gather the materials for the machinery you need to get lives.** -"Before we go any further, I believe it would be pertinent to set up the infrastructure you need to maintain access to the teleportarium. The energy costs are steep, but it beats dying. To make your life here a little easier I'll even assemble it for you, provided you get me the materials. The Dust should be simple enough to get, just carve up a couple of the creatures. Steel is everywhere, just tear some steel structural blocks or steel siding blocks off a building and melt them down. Hell, even steel furniture can be recycled. Cobble is easy, you can dig down beneath the surface layers or even go to the quarry north of here to grab some from the trade machines. Iron, copper and lead, however, will be more difficult to find. You'll have to mine for them, and that means going down into the caves. They're everywhere on Mortua, but if I were you I'd make sure I wasn't still underground when the sun sets... Once you have the machinery, setting it up is easy. Just place your generator and then place the batt-box mk.II right next to it. Throw some fuel in the generator and the batt-box will start to build up a charge. You can place your batt-pack mk.II in the batt-box to charge it up. I'll throw in an extra Batt-Pack, just because I like you."

betterquesting.name: Nick Of Time
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain an Acknowledge Network Prompt item.** -"Not immediately using a network prompt is usually a bad idea, but for the sake of this learning experience I'll need you to submit one to me. I'll give it right back, of course, so don't worry. If you're not sure what I'm talking about, then you need to read up on it in the quest Welcome Home."

betterquesting.name: The Dust Must Flow
betterquesting.desc: **Read about the different ways to obtain Dust, then gather six Dust for the Ad-mech.** -To get into the Ad-mech bunker you'll need some Dust, one of Blood & Irons most valuable resources. Used in everything from crafting to laying down signal wires, Dust is the only resource you'll be using more than steel. The best way to get it is by killing mobs. You can also mine it in any biome, as it appears underground in the form of Dust lodes. In some biomes you can even find Dust blocks sitting on the surface. Additionally, with advanced agricultural technology, you can grow Dust. Finally, there are some abilities that give you Dust. Use one of the previously mentioned methods to obtain six Dust.

betterquesting.name: Technological Unemployment
betterquesting.desc: **Gather the materials to build basic processing machines.** -"I think you've got most of the essentials covered, but now you'll be needing some refined materials to fuel your war machine. These machines are the basic, mark one models. There's a staggering amount of things they can do, but I'll leave it up to you to find out. Just remember to view recipes and usages of various things if you're wondering how they're made. Aside from the processors, I'll also build an overclocker. You can place it in most machines and at the cost of more energy usage they'll operate faster. Beats building more machines."

betterquesting.name: Raiders Of The Lost Crypt
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a stash of STC's and some Dust in the ancient crypt.** -Peering into an ancient drawer you see row upon row of jars filled with Dust, glittering in the darkness. Underneath some of the jars you notice some papers. The papers are covered with unusual markings that look like bar codes, and you suddenly recall your cogitator having a scan function for occasions such as this.

betterquesting.name: Law Of The Land
betterquesting.desc: **Find out the locations of the survivors.** -From the sounds of it Mortua's fucked, but you still need to make contact with the survivors before you make any official determinations. It may also prove wise to complete some of the tasks Endel issued you in "Ab Initio" as it seems he's offering a substantial reward. Considering your ship and supplies now strewn across several kilometers of wasteland, you're going to have to start from nothing.

tasks.description: Speak with Endel and learn about the survivors.

betterquesting.name: Meet The New Boss
betterquesting.desc: **Speak to the head Tech-priest. The access code is 3954.** -Thankfully, the Ad-mech has held their bunker. You can finally find out exactly what's happened, you just need to talk to the person, or thing, in charge. Regardless of the circumstances, you're completely sure of one thing: you need to secure a spacecraft. You're resolute that you're not going to die on a shit-hole like Mortua, and to those ends you'll need a plan B.

tasks.description: Speak with the head tech-priest and find out what happened on Mortua.
Speak with the head tech-preist about finding a ship.
Speak with the head tech-priest about getting some assistance.

betterquesting.name: Golden Ticket
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a cache of gold and Dust in the ancient crypt.** -The collapsed portion of the crypt contains rows of drawers, mostly empty. Nearing the end of the final row, you find it difficult to slide out a container wedged inside, and only after some effort do you manage to dislodge it. A bounty of gold ingots and Dust sit before you, begging to be taken and put to better use.

betterquesting.name: Needful Things
betterquesting.desc: **Locate Drucilla and speak with her about her job offer.** -"A job offer from a big-shot like Makko can mean one thing: a chance at gaining more favor. I'll speak with this person, but they had better not waste my time."

betterquesting.name: Small Guns 20
betterquesting.desc: A score of 20 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Parallel Assembly
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for automating assembly of anything with a recipe.** -"The Assembly Unit is capable of operating in two modes: Single Pattern Mode and Interface Fed Mode. Single Pattern Mode is quite simply, and merely requires that you place an Encoded Pattern in the unit. It will then accept objects fed into it from any side, and using some power, will automatically craft whatever is encoded on the inserted pattern. Interface Fed Mode is much more complicated, but it's also much more versatile. For it you'll need to attach an Interface Panel to at least one side of the assembler. The Interface Panel is then loaded up with multiple Encoded Patterns, and when a request is made from a terminal for an item, it will automatically craft it, provided it has the correct crafting instructions. The snag in the whole thing is the processing power needed to compute and monitor all the variables. For that, you'll need to attach a Crafting CPU to the network."

betterquesting.name: Abominable Intelligence
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for making the network "smart".** -"The network is a sophisticated tool that uses technology we can barely fathom, but sometimes it still needs extra computing power to process the sheer volume of tasks at hand. For that, you'll need several things. Start with the Crafting Unit, the basis for the Crafting CPU. You'll need at least one, and you'll also need at least a 1k ME Storage Cell, but you can opt for more if you wish. By attaching the 1k Crafting Storage unit to the network, you now can view the detailed information on the various automated functions of it. If you want to view and manage more functions, you'll need more Crafting Storage Units. If you want to speed up one function, you have some more options. You can connect different storage units via a Crafting Co-Processing Unit, and you can also increase the size of the storage units you're using. Finally, if you're the sort that loves staring at screens all day, you can attach a Crafting Monitor to your CPU and see what it's doing at a glance."

betterquesting.desc: A score of 30 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Birth Of A Nation
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the sewers. Locate and deal with the runaway slaves. The access code is 3312.** -It seems that this motley crew has a slave problem, and they're not happy. With such a tremendous dependence on slavery it's easy to see why this society would be so agitated about the idea of runaways arming themselves. Not being content to merely live out their lives with some modicum of freedom, they have even taken to raiding houses and stores in the middle of the night, making hasty getaways via pipes and loose grates. It seems more than just speculation to say that at this point they have a base of operations in the sewers, and being the newest addition to this merry band of killers the job of hunting them down falls on you. It's certainly a chance to prove your worth.

betterquesting.name: Melee Weapons 20
betterquesting.desc: A score of 20 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Melee Weapons 30
betterquesting.desc: A score of 30 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Melee Weapons 40
betterquesting.desc: A score of 40 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: A Message They Won't Forget
betterquesting.desc: **Kill the leader of the slaves and at least six slaves.** -The leader of the slaves is some sort of disfigured mutant, and he's got quite the following. To stop the raids and put an end to this problem for good, you can kill him and enough of his followers to scare off the rest. It's a dirty job, but someone's got to do it.

betterquesting.name: Melee Weapons 50
betterquesting.desc: A score of 50 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Melee Weapons 60
betterquesting.desc: A score of 60 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: A Hungry Man's An Angry Man
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain 32 Civilian Rations.** -Dominic claims that a shipment of civilian rations will be enough to hold his people over long enough for it to look like you took care of this. What happens afterward is someone else's problem.

If that fails, you'll still have bought enough time to make the authorities think you took care of the slaves. It's a win-win.

tasks.description: Speak with Dominic about holding off.

betterquesting.name: Infinite Skies
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Skyhook, Structural Cable and Cable Connectors.** -"The Skyhook is a useful tool that lets you ride across structural cables at decent speeds. It's fun and convenient, but more importantly it keeps you off the ground. Just attach the Cable Connectors to point A and point B, no more than 50 or so meters apart, run the cable, and use the Skyhook to ride it up, down or across. Have fun!"

betterquesting.name: Hot Metal Street
betterquesting.desc: **Craft 27 Reinforced Blast Bricks, two Pre-Heaters and construct the Improved Blast Furnace.** -"By now you've likely grown to despise the sheer volume of fuel the Crude Blast Furnace hogs up. If that's the case, consider building the Improved Blast Furnace. If you have the electricity, the Pre-Heaters will do the cooking for you."

betterquesting.name: Survival 60
betterquesting.desc: A score of 60 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Mortua Anomaly
betterquesting.desc: **Encounter the entities.** -The things you're seeing are unlike anything you've ever imagined. A legion of loping nightmares, and they're hell-bent on clawing you into a world of pain. From what you can tell they don't communicate, behaving like animals, but their supernatural strength and unworldly powers make up for it. Most disturbingly, they seem to come from out of no where. It's as if the darkness itself gives way to some terrible dimension of pain and hate and shits these things out. In a fit of infantile desperation you pray to the Emperor that the light is enough to keep them away. In your heart you know only your gun and your wits will save you now.

betterquesting.name: Slough Of Despair
betterquesting.desc: **Kill 10 Belphs.** -Scaly, horned beasts with the ability to throw searing flame. These man-sized monsters seem to be a foot soldier of some kind, constantly scouring the wastes for any trace of life. They are aggressive, robust and extremely curious, never ceasing in their endless search for life.

betterquesting.name: Pandemonium
betterquesting.desc: **Kill 10 Trites.** -Scurrying horrors with that resemble a human head which has sprouted arachnoid appendages. Their disjointed appearance betrays their grace, leaping through and weaving between blows. As if their mere presence were not unnerving enough, they also seem to have a venomous bite.

betterquesting.name: House Of Pain
betterquesting.desc: **Kill 10 Nether Souls.** -Terrifying howls fill the night air, and overhead you see it: a fiery, cybernetic skull. They seem to hone in on their targets with unerring accuracy, and work as a pack to bring them down with their horns. Weak as they are, their death seems to trigger the immolation of some fuel source, potentially taking their assailant with them.

betterquesting.name: Unholy Cathedral
betterquesting.desc: **Kill 10 Pinkys.** -A low snort and the sickening smell of blood and fresh manure is the first sign that one of these creatures is nearby. It moves like a plow tipped with a gaping maw of rotting, jagged teeth. It's blank white eyes make it seem like some kind of soul-less eating machine. It's highly aggressive, fast, and difficult to kill.

betterquesting.name: Dis
betterquesting.desc: **Kill three Behemoths.** -Towering hulks of corded muscle, these cloven-footed devils can be heard barking orders and directing the lesser entities in battle. They are a fearsome sight to behold on the as they stride through gunfire to hurl blazing globes of green plasma.

betterquesting.name: Temple Of Trials
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and enter the Temple Of Trials. The access code is 2263.** -The whole situation seems bizarre, starting with the entities, and now this. It's almost like you're on some demented game show, and you can barely contain your anxiety at the thought of having to assemble a silver knick-knack at the end of this "trial". You resolve yourself to go through with it in the hopes that it somehow gets you closer to your goals.

betterquesting.name: The Prophecy
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with the Prophet. The access code is 9196.** -Trudging across the endless waste, your vision suddenly erupts in a blinding flash of light as you feel your very being torn from it's shell. You find yourself standing in a world shaded in a deep blue haze that drinks up all light, the vague outline of a cloaked figure a few meters from you. It beckons to you and as if on rails you are propelled forward. The being holds out it's hands and gestures into the distance, a stretch of twisted land bathed in darkness. Suddenly you come to in a stupor, not knowing how much time has passed. You look around nervously, scarcely recollecting the events of the past few moments. One thing's clear, though: you must speak with the figure, and you know exactly where he is."

betterquesting.name: Double Agency
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the Mia Ayyid Memorial Housing unit. The access code is 2873. WARNING: completing this quest will make the Imperium hostile toward you and lock you out of "Noblesse Oblige".** -"The missions that Burke's people issued me before were benign compared to this. What I'm reading is clearly an order to assassinate the last Imperial leader on Mortua. According to intel reports my target simply goes by the title "Administrator", and this Administrator's been manipulating the poor Imperial fools using some very unorthodox methods. It's almost admirable. He and his command staff are currently located in an unassuming building on level two of the Imperial vault. It's there that they've secretly constructed a command center from which they'll direct their army with revanchist fervor. Style aside, the man's a brutal tyrant, even by my standards, so I'll have no reservations about putting a bolt in his head. Such treachery will be an unforgivable, and there'll be no turning back, but I'll become something else, something different. What a part of me fears is that I'll become something much better. The power, the possibility. This is my chance!"

tasks.name: Mia Ayyid Memorial Apartments - Level Two

betterquesting.name: Where Eagles Dare
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and eliminate Narfok, the leader of the Rippers. The access code is 5515.** -"The Rippers are more like a pack of wolves than a gang. They roam the streets at night, picking off vagrants and junkies. What they do with them was something even these people wouldn't divulge, but from what I gathered the gangs calling card is a pile of assorted gore. They're made up of lunatics, psychopaths and criminals: the dredges of society. Narfok gives them cheap armor, Rippers, and all the chems they stomach. Narfok himself is a formidable psyker and warrior in his own right. He carries around a broken arrow, the remains of a rival's stifled assassination attempt, that I must retrieve to confirm the kill. In another time Narfok and Shiva would have been Champions, but they took to bickering and couldn't let it go; now it will be the end of both."

betterquesting.name: Fortress Of Desolation
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the Lost & Damned's vault.** -Even as you suspect that you're being lead into a trap, you can't shrug the sensation that you need to be in that vault. You have no plans to join this band of misfits and lunatics, but you can't pass up the opportunity to learn more about them. Finally, the prospect of this power Gyx spoke of has an allure of its own, despite your attempts to press it out of mind.

betterquesting.name: Limbo
betterquesting.desc: **Kill three Astaroths.** -A cybernetic cradle suspends this globe of cackling flesh as it lumbers forward on piston-driven legs. Marching forward inexorably, it gets just close enough to deliver it's lethal payload of plasma fire. Perhaps it could be picked over for scrap metal once it's dispatched, but you'd rather not get too close to a living one.

betterquesting.name: Erebus
betterquesting.desc: **Kill three Cacodemons.** -Great flying horrors garbed in a coat of sickening red ichor. Their enormous green eye darting back and forth as they tirelessly scan the horizon, vaporizing anything caught in their malign gaze. Weak of form but granted the ability to project orbs of crackling electrical force, these creatures are in ever-present threat in the dark skies of Mortua.

betterquesting.name: Gangbusters
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and eliminate Shiva, the leader of the Fallen Saints. The access code is 2394.** -"Burke's forces are actually a loose confederation of different sub-factions. As far as can be counted there are: Fanatics, Loyalists, Outcasts, Hereteks, Slaves, Mutants and finally the gangs. The gangs are a nuisance at the least and an example at the worst, but it's the general threat to vault cohesion that the Lost & Damned authorities are apprehensive about. The two main gangs are the Fallen Saints and the Rippers, both lead by maniacs who's hatred for each other is matched only by their blood-thirst. The endless, petty conflict plays out on the streets of level two, and it wanes and waxes as attrition takes its toll, but the gangs numbers will always be stable as long as there's some mooks eager to prove how tough they are. This will all change soon, because my first assignment is to assassinate Shiva and her inner circle, ending the Fallen Saints for good. She apparently carries a small jewel with her, and I am to turn it in as proof of death."

betterquesting.name: War Criminal
betterquesting.desc: **Poison everyone in Deeana's building.** -Small, tight spaces that rely on central ventilation systems are often susceptible to mass-poison attacks. It would be a dishonorable move to be sure, but dumping toxins into the HVAC of Deeana's building would put a swift end to her rebellion.

tasks.description: Gain access to Deeana's building's HVAC system.

betterquesting.name: Administrative Action
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with the Administrator about the true size of the Imperial Forces before eliminating him. The access code is 9119.** -"The Administrator won't be expecting this. The command center is filled with agents and technicians, pencil pushers, but they form the backbone of the Imperial administration on Mortua. All I have to do is take out the Administrator, waste the nerds, and wait for backup. Agents are already waiting for my signal. As soon as I take this bastard down they'll move in, and from there we, or more specifically I, can take control of the vault. Before I put him down, though, I need to find out about this army he's been building, and if it'll pose a threat to future operations."

betterquesting.name: Industrial War
betterquesting.desc: **Locate Makko and speak with him about what happened with the Administrator.** -"Reporting these disturbing developments to Makko is the best move."

tasks.description: Speak with Makko about your encounter with the Administrator.

betterquesting.name: Twisted Pantheon
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain a bottle of whiskey.** -"Listen, de first tin you gotta know is dat dare be three Gods dat reign eternal, beyond de veil of human perceptions. Dey can grant mortals power beyond ya wildest dreams, but dey can take it away just as easily. If you wanna be stayin on dare good side, stick wit what I be tellin you. First, you be gettin dis one some whiskey, ta clear dis foggy head ah mine. Then, I show you a glimpse ah de power I be speakin of."

betterquesting.name: Blood For The Blood God
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain organs for your offering to the Blood God.** -"De Blood God, Khorne, ain't no weakling, child. He demand violence be done, and not ta anyone in particular. He prefer it be in martial combat, but even de blood of innocents is better den none. Best place ta spill blood 'round here? It be de surface, and he be just as pleased with beast blood as mans."

betterquesting.name: Bones Of The Old World
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain recyclable building materials from buildings in the wasteland.** -"Dis world was dead on arrival, but even de dead got someting ta give de living. Go out dare inta de wasteland and search high and low for de metal bones of de world we meant ta build. Melt dem down and make yourself steel, and wit da steel make yourself strong. Truth be told it's a hell of a life, but you do what you gotta ta survive, you hear?"

betterquesting.name: Death And Decay
betterquesting.desc: **Kill Pinkies and let their organs rot to make an offering to the God of Decay.** -"Dare be few mortals who don't fear mistah death, or who don't dread de thought ah gettin sick, losing dare mind and body ta creepin plague. Dis fear feeds into Nurgle, de god a death 'n decay. Nurgle don't see nothin wrong wit what he do, he see de sickness as a blessin, and if you submit ta him come whatever, you will live eternal. Dis comes wit a steep price for some, as dare bodies 'come host ta insects and all sorts ah creepies, or dey bloat up and stink real bad, drippin bile and festerin rot as dey lumber. Dey don't die doe, cause death ain't de main goal of ol' papa Nurgle. He wanna see de illness bite and gnaw and chew until de madness drives de victims inta his pock-marked arms. Get some of de remains ah doz Pinkies, let em rot up real nice, and make papa an offerin he can't resist."

betterquesting.name: Spirits In My Head
betterquesting.desc: **Craft booze.** -"By now you be seein de effects ah de madness settin in. You see strange tings and hear noises, and if you live long enough like dat you never snap out. De booze be helpin with dat, doe. Just have a drink and forget ya troubles. So, get de stuff tagether ta make some mash, we makin booze!"

betterquesting.name: Pleasure Cult
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain chems for the pleasure cult.** -"De world is often made bright only by de pleasures we find in it. Booze, drugs, food, sex, it is dees tings dat many seek solace from de pain of life in. It is dis desire for thrill and emotional high dat gives power to Slaanesh, a god of decadence and excess. It's followers revel in de most depraved acts of pleasure and pain, seeking ever greater and more exhilarating experiences. Our own pleasure cult itself hosts gatherings here on occasion, and donating de drugs for it would be a good way to gain some small amount of favor from de prince of pleasure."

betterquesting.name: The Keepers Of The Crypt
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain the Daemonifuge. The access code is 3365.** -"Can you hear it now, dear Commissar? Yes, I know you are, but don't you worry now, your secret be safe wit me. De truth of tings is more cloudy den  simply good or bad anyway, so don't you dwell on it neither. There be one final test for you my friend, and it be de most difficult one yet. You see, to win de favor of a single power is one ting, to curry favor of Chaos undivided is another. To be a true champion you must carry de banner of each God, and possess a strength of body and soul beyond measure. If you are ready, go to dees coordinates. Dare you will find a crypt which was hastily concealed in de early days of de colonization. It is dare now, undisturbed, and waiting ta yield it's treasures to one who is worthy. Go dare, and use de code 3365. You will find great treasure, danger, and most importantly, de Daemonifuge. Bring me it and tagether, but be careful, for de dreams dat tell me de secrets of Mortua, dey tell me of danger dare, both real and imagined."

betterquesting.name: Antiquities
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain the ancient artifacts found in tombs and crypts on Mortua's surface.** -"De ancient people of Mortua were far more in tune wit de primordial powers of de universe than de modern man. Dey crafted many fine works for dare progeny to cherish, but such as it is, dare was no progeny, and we shall inherit de riches. De artifacts are of such power dat I fear even studying dem may lead to my death, but dat is de price of power. Now, get me de artifacts and we will put dis knowledge to use!"

betterquesting.name: Grave Pact
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain the ancient artifacts found in tombs and crypts on Mortua's surface.** -"Dare be a god of vast intellect, whose wisdom spans time and space, and to it mortals are de pieces in a grand game. To dis god you can only appeal by virtue of de pursuit of knowledge and de desire for change. To plot, skulk and lay ploys for men of lesser intellect is de realm of Tzeentch. Ta truly get his attention you must lay out a grand scheme indeed, but fa now we stick to dis: retrieven articles of intellectual value."

betterquesting.name: Blood Magic
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange gore for meat and water.** -"De powers of blood make men stronger and more fierce, dey let us take power from our enemies and turn it back on dem. To stay strong in dis place you needin be fed and watered propah, so for you He does dis: take da flesh of dem beasts and make de meat of a swine, take de blood and make de water of life. This is how you will fight, den..always full and neva wantin for de essentials."

betterquesting.name: Great Unclean One
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange scrap parts and rot for 8mm ammo.** -"Nurgle's more usual blessins ain't someting dat be conducive to de goals of either you or de regime, if you catch my drift. He does reward his followers wit more den sickness, you just have to be clever about it. Get some scrap metal and rot, and you see if papa can turn dat pitted, rusted, metal into a weapon, and use de rot to bring his power into de land of de livin."

betterquesting.name: High Times
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange tough flesh for chems.** -"Once you be in Slaanesh's favor you be de recipient of all manner of depraved things, de least of which be food, drink and chems. Let me tell you doe, de more you submit to de drugs and de gluttony, da more de decadence pushes your soul to Slaanesh, and de curse of Slaanesh's followers is to always crave de ever greater high. So make your offerings of de flesh of your tortured enemies, and Slaanesh will answer, but beware dat sweet voice, drawing you into de simple pursuit of desire alone, for de champion's place is higher than de cultist."

betterquesting.name: Sourcery
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange steel for plasteel or ceramite.** -"De god of schemes, conspiracy and knowledge be more tangled madness den anyting, but dat is not to say dat he do not see the nature of the universe as easily as de back of a stage wit no curtains. To brush aside all known laws and truths and twist de material universe to whatever shape he fancy wit de flick of a wrist..dis is childs play to Tzeentch. So it shall be dat his esteemed followers receive similar abilities, if it be in dare hearts to change de world, that dey may. Take de picture in your mind's eye and den make it real."

betterquesting.name: Arsenal Of The Damned
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange Dust for ammunition.** -"Now dat you have de attention of de Ruinous Powers, it is time to receive de blessings. You are a champion now, in spirit if not in mind, and your potential can only grow. De power you got be someting no one but de Gods can take away, and so long as you stay in dare favor you shall live forever, never thirsty, hungry, bored, poor or weak. Dis is de power of Chaos, and now you know! An offering of de Dust ought be enough to bring de gift from the ethereal into de real, considerin its value in both places."

betterquesting.name: Devil In The Flesh
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with Burke.** -"If what Makko says is true then not only has Burke returned from her self-imposed exile, but she's done it because of my actions. I'm not sure what to think of this; on the one hand, I've burnt all my bridges with the Imperials, on the other, I have my doubts about serving under a woman who is regarded as a war criminal. Regardless of my reservations, I have no choice but to meet her. It's the only way to measure her up and see what she's made of."

betterquesting.name: Steel Jungle
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain Deana's implant. The access code is 3669.** -"Burke's forces have apparently encountered one last snag on their way to consolidating their power: the Vipers. They're some kind of cult of snake worshippers, and their leader Deana is said to have inexplicable abilities. The cult's known for their obsession with sensations, pleasure and pain, taken to great extremes. The pleasure part naturally draws in the crowds; the pain part starts once the doors are locked. They're refusing Burke's summons, and have now fortified a building on the third level. I'll have to go in, take out Deana, their leader, dig a neural implant out of her skull, and return it to Burke. The implant was one of a rare few distributed to very high ranking Imperial officers during the campaigns that gave Burke her reputation as a formidable commander. From my reckoning I'd say that Deana and Burke may have been friends at one time, maybe she was even a confidant. Who knows. Taking down Deana will be no easy task, but doing so will put me in a good position with Burke. It must be done."

betterquesting.name: Warchest
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain raw materials for the Dark-Mech.** -"Now that slaving and raiding has proved insufficient in fueling Burke's war machine, they turn to me. After all, I'm the most resourceful operative they have, and they know it. The sheer volume of resources they're asking for can mean only one thing: they're preparing for war, and it's only a matter of time before I get called into action."

betterquesting.name: Mortori Te Salutant
betterquesting.desc: **Defeat the aspiring champions and obtain their insignias.** -"Many pledge themselves to the same dark gods as Burke, and in exchange they're granted powers beyond mortal reckoning. I don't understand the process entirely, but I know their lust for power, pleasure, vitality or knowledge is the catalyst for the reaction. Of those that pledge themselves only the strongest survive the struggle to win their gods favor, and those individuals are known as Aspiring Champions. I must confront four of them in Burke's arena, and I intend to do more than aspire."

betterquesting.name: Bloodbath
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain 256 Dust.** -"This arena is more than just an amphitheater, it's a great temple that's somehow tapped into the primordial chaos that lurks just behind the veneer of reality. With the flick of a switch empty space crackles with unseen energies as snarling, wretched, nightmare creatures flicker into existence. Curiously, it's the same manner of beast that seems to dominate the surface past dusk. There may be some truth to the rumors about Burke; she has forged some pact with dark powers, and now holds sway over their minions. Perhaps that is what it means to truly be a champion in this strange religion. For now, I'll serve Burke\u0027s bidding and labor in this bloodbowl to gather Dust like some minion, but soon she'll know my real strength."

betterquesting.name: Spirit Lodge
betterquesting.desc: **Locate Crasius and speak with him. The access code is 556.** -"Before I can be included in her plans for the second Mortuan war, Burke insists I meet with some self-styled shaman named Crasius. He was some kind of feral worlder before escaping to more civilized locales, but he hasn't forgotten about his native culture. She says that if I'm to be an effective servant, I'll need to be enlightened. What the hell that means is beyond me, but from what I hear it involves lots of mind altering substances and bed rest, something I've been sorely missing."

betterquesting.name: Dark Necessities
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the elevator to the first level. Locate and speak with Makko. The access code is 3199.** -The soldiers in the base are highly disciplined, ruthless and above all, utterly corrupt. Whatever's going on, you know that revealing your status as a Commissar will earn you no friends here, and may in fact get you killed. You decide to lay low and rely on your skills to prove your worth to this strange faction.

betterquesting.name: Frankenstein, I Presume
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the elevator to level two. Locate and speak with Seth, the leader of the Dark Mechanicus.** -The leadership of the faction being in disarray has clearly not deterred it from carrying on with business as usual. You note thriving slave trade and blood sport industries being the chief commercial pursuits of this society, with rot farming coming in for a close third with arms trading. The odd coalition that has assembled here seem bound by one thing: their indifference to traditional Imperial values. It crosses your mind that these people are also very exploitable, and you struggle to keep yourself from grinning.

betterquesting.name: Kill Or Be Killed
betterquesting.desc: **Kill Deeanna and obtain her implant.** -You suspect that facing down Deeana's entire gang on their turf may be a suicide mission, but that with the liberal application of explosives it may just be possible. You nervously reach for some grenades, hoping that at least a few are incendiary.

betterquesting.name: The End Is Near
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with General Sarpedon.** -"After years of living in ignorance of my past and myself, I'm finally awake. My power is obvious to me, and how I missed it before is unfathomable. Another trick of the Inquisition, I presume. Now that my chains are cast off, I'm finally free. Free to pursue power, wealth and glory. Free to bring Mortua under my heel. I will take what is mine, and the first step is making my way to Varakesh. The ancient, subterranean city where Burke discovered the primordial truth. My destiny lies there, midst the rivers of fire and obsidian spires. It's there that I'll ascend to my rightful place. General Sarpedon awaits me at the Cave of Koilos, a winding, natural cavern that snakes it's way to the city. I need only to muster the forces under my command before I can set forth into the gates of hell."

tasks.description: speak with Drucilla about her job

betterquesting.name: Daemonic Tutor
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with the collector. The access code is 2221.** -"From what I gather this collector is some sort of specialist on the occult, and his library was the envy of Mortua's eccentric community of supernatural "researchers". This was all before the war, or course. Now, he's just a lonely old man surrounded by books that no one really cares about. My employer expects me to kill this man, this I know, but what she doesn't know is that I have no intention of doing so, at least until I have a better idea of what this book she wants is, and just how much it's worth."

betterquesting.name: Silence Is Golden
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the original owner and obtain the first page.** -"As Roman puts it, the man he bought the book off of is a "cantankerous old codger" who "lives as far away from the bulk of humanity as he can, to dabble in depravities that would make a cultist shudder". I don't know whether to be frightened or impressed, but either way, it looks like I'll be heading back into the wasteland to find out what happened to this missing page. Roman was nice enough to provide me with a code to the crazy bastards spider hole. An unusually well informed shut-in, that Roman."

betterquesting.name: Open That Which Is Closed
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the Charon and obtain the second page.** -"The Charon was a cargo vessel that ferried goods around Mortua for the brief period of time when civilian traffic wasn't grounded. Roman claims the vessel was carrying some important documents of his, a page of the book among them, before it disappeared without a trace. He's been dumping a lot of resources into finding the ship, and his efforts haven't been in vain. He explained that his scouts had recently determined the location of the crash site but had failed to gain entry to the wreck. Fortunately, he's given me the ships entry code as well as the code to its safe, but first I have to find a way in."

betterquesting.name: Lost Words Keep Secrets
betterquesting.desc: **Locate Roman's former partner and obtain the third page.** -"Roman speaks of a former partner of his in the Mortuan rare book and artifact business, such as it was. Somewhere along the line things went sour, and this partner took off with one of the pages. He's now out there in the wasteland and Roman says he knows where, on account of a tracking device in the dupes armor. It seems he's settled on the top of a mesa two days from the vault exit. I should move fast if I want to catch up."

betterquesting.name: Fate Is Not The Same For All
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the antique dealer and obtain the fourth page.** -"The fourth page is being held by an unscrupulous antique dealer named Wek. He's a shady character for sure, and his shop is buried midst the filth in the bazaar, appropriately enough. He understands the value of the page and is holding out for an exorbitant sum. I can't say I blame him, for despite all sense and reason, there is far more to this book than paper and ink. I've seen with my own eyes the power of the knowledge contained within, and now that I've wielded this force with my own hand there is little room for doubt. The magic, the Daemons, the corruption of Mortua; they're all connected. At the center of it all is the force referred to as Chaos. Since Chaos has been elevated to a religion, perhaps this book is it's sacred text of sorts. If that's the case, it's easy to understand why so many would die in pursuit of it; it contains the secrets of life and death."

betterquesting.name: In Vain
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the raider leader and obtain the fifth page. The access code is 3696.** -"It seems the book has a strong following; in fact, Roman informs me that an entire gang of vagabonds has taken quite the interest in it. Lead by a man named Deacon, the gang makes its living raiding tombs and settlements, using their ill-gotten gains to finance their quest for the elusive third book. It also seems that Deacon has managed to obtain the fifth and final page of Romans copy, which means that I'll be paying him and his merry gang a visit in the very near future."

betterquesting.name: Enriched By Death
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the Keymaster and obtain the cipher. The access code is 542.** -After a thorough looting of the premises you discover a small notebook tucked away behind the couch. It seems to be a log where Deacon jotted down some brief notes on the gang's operations. Apparently, the raider base was deliberately constructed at this location to attempt to crack into the arcane repository, an impossibly large ancient archive and the resting place of the third book. While they were able to get the archives massive door open, they were not prepared for what was inside, and were just recently getting their hands on the supplies they needed to explore it. There's also something about a "Keymaster" scribbled in the margins, with reference to a cipher that is needed to access the final book. The location of the Keymaster is listed, but little else.

betterquesting.name: The Student Becomes The Master
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the Keeper and obtain the third book. The access code is 9928.** -The Keeper rests on a platform perched high above the endless shelves of the archive. An ancient construct of war, equipped with weaponry from the dark age of technology, it stands a silent vigil over the boundless ranks of forbidden tomes. It won't be easy, but you must somehow wrest the third book from the things grasp.

betterquesting.name: From Darkness Comes Light
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with Drucilla.** -"Now that I've fulfilled my obligations to Drucilla and Roman, I can finally get the books together for a thorough examination. I admit that when I embarked upon this journey I was a naive fool. I doubted the power of the book, and of Chaos. Now that I've glimpsed it's pages, I am enlightened. I only need to know one thing now, and that is which power I intend to wield with what scarce sacred knowledge my feeble mortal mind can contain."

betterquesting.name: Power Overwhelming
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange steel, Dust and gore for Bolt ammo.** -"Arcane rites and blood oaths empower the practitioner to conjure forth complex things from the warp itself, but nothing is without a cost. With an offering of blood, Dust and steel to act as a vessel, I believe I can even conjure Bolt ammo. Truly, we are blessed by the gods of Chaos, that they see to our protection while the Emperor rots on his throne of lies."

betterquesting.name: Agriculture
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain agricultural products.** -"Feeding and clothing the horde of soldiers, sycophants and slaves that collectively comprise Burke's forces is no small feat. Tremendous amounts of military grade rations and cellulux will be needed, but everything that helps the war effort also helps me."

betterquesting.name: Finished Goods
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain finished goods.** -"Even with access to archeotech and slaves the Dark-Mech struggles to meet the needs of a force the size of Burke's. By turning some of my industry toward the production of these parts, I can accelerate the time table for the invasion considerably. When slaves just won't cut it you can always turn to simple mechanical ingenuity. "

betterquesting.name: Cultists
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 20: periodically access free Cultists.** -"The Cultists are the dredges of Burke's army. Nothing more than cannon fodder, they won't even stay in one spot long enough to act as sentries. I'll call on them only when I need them, and they should at least provide some entertainment. Thankfully there's no shortage of these crazy bastards, so recruiting them is essentially free."

betterquesting.name: Dark Hearts
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 30: periodically access Traitor Guard.** -"The Traitor guard were just average guardsmen who sided with Burke and then lived long enough to get to this point. Battlefield experience and exposure to Chaos energies means they're tougher, more aggressive and sturdier than their Imperial counterparts."

10.Line:8: [the traitor guard slumps lifelessly to the ground]

betterquesting.name: People Of The Sun
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 40: periodically access Plasma Traitor Guards.** -"Traitor Guardsmen armed with Plasma Rifles are formidable warriors. However, I must take note that plasma weaponry, while powerful, is not as accurate or far-reaching as laser weaponry, making these troops more tricky to deploy."

10.Line:8: [the plasma traitor slumps lifelessly to the ground]
[the traitor guard polishes his plasma rifle]

betterquesting.name: Assault And Battery
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 50: periodically access Shotgun Traitor Guards.** -"More than a Traitor Guardsmen with a shotgun, these stim-addicted soldiers are fanatical in battle, quickly closing in on their foes to maximize the damage their 8 gauge shotguns deal. They're tougher than the average Traitor Guardsman, which says a good deal about their survivability."

10.Line:8: [the shotgun traitor slumps lifelessly to the ground]

betterquesting.name: Champions Of The Faith
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 80: periodically access Berserkers and Champions.** -"When a servant of the primordial powers achieves a certain level of prestige and notoriety they become elevated by their chosen power to the rank of Champion. These Champions are among the most fierce and powerful of the Lost and Damned's warriors and they come equipped with power armor and bolters, weapons typically wielded only by the Astartes. They are elite troops and should be deployed only when facing overwhelming odds. The Berserkers are Champions in their own right, but are obsessed with close combat. They are driven by an insatiable blood lust, which combined with their experience, armor and expertise, makes them quite formidable foes. Their only weakness lies in their total disregard for ranged weaponry, meaning they will stubbornly charge headfirst into any battle."

10.Line:8: [the berserker tumbles lifelessly to the ground]

Entity:10.MercenaryDialogFarewell:8: I won't stick around for long.

10.Line:8: [the champion slumps lifelessly to the ground]

betterquesting.name: Agents Of Change
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 70: periodically access Sorcerers.** -"The value of most Cultists is questionable, but a select few rise above their peers to become unparalelled warriors. The best among them become usually aspire to become sorcerers of great power, who can lay waste to their enemies with the flick of the wrist or a malevolent glance. These men and women have wholly devoted their lives to Tzeench, and serve it mind, body and soul. On the battlefield they zealously cut down their enemies at range and up close, cleaving them with sword and melting them with warp fire. They are incredibly resilient, and able to heal themselves in the midst of pitched combat."

10.Line:8: Where you're going, you won't need eyes!
[the sorcerer vanishes in a strange cloud]
You see the truth of things.

Entity:10.MercenaryDialogFarewell:8: I will meditate on our victory.

betterquesting.name: Super Mutant March
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 60: periodically access Ogryns.** -"When the civil war broke out Burke's forces were left with little choice but to accept the aid of anyone they could, even mutants. Some of the greatest of the monsters are the Ogryn, likely brought here for manual labor. These Ogryn in particular have fallen under the sway of the religion that has swept through the ranks of the rest of Burke's forces and as such have become bloodthirsty killing machines. Armed with a rocket launcher, they are able to lob explosive munitions over long distances. Up close they are a terror to behold, crushing and battering their enemies with whatever they can."

10.Line:8: [the ogryn slumps lifelessly to the ground]

betterquesting.name: Industrial Terror
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 90: periodically access Obliterators.** "From what I've learned the lumbering, twisted mounds of flesh and metal that serve as mobile gun platforms are called Obliterators. I have no idea what could cause such a thing to happen to a man, but I suspect it's more sinister than simple cybernetics and gene-therapy. Regardless, they're as tough as an armored vehicle and have enough firepower to level cities."

10.Line:8: [the obliterator lets out a metallic cry]
[the guardsman slumps lifelessly to the ground]
[the obliterator howls as ammo belts push their way through its skin]

betterquesting.name: Raw Materials
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain raw materials.** -"The war machine demands a steady stream of raw materials, and who am I to deny it. The mining shouldn't be too difficult, especially with the assistance of auto-miners. A Blast Furnace Mk.II should help when it comes to making the steel without having to come up with carbon. As for the Uranium, well, there's got to be a mine somewhere."

betterquesting.name: Total War
betterquesting.desc: **Get war readiness to 100.** -"Varakesh. The ancient city will be the object of the final war for Mortua, and to the victor goes the spoils. In the heart of the necropolis lies the salvation of both sides. For Burke, the ability to achieve apotheosis, becoming a godlike daemon princess. For Francisco, the means to ending the warp storms and banishing the daemons back to the immaterium. What is certain of the outcome is that force of arms will carry the day, and to those ends I must ensure that my side is fully prepared for the conflict."

betterquesting.name: The Masters Gifts
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange a stick for an unusual weapon.** -"As part of my reward for "serving him", the collector has offered to teach me how to perform various rituals which, as he puts it, "will grant me powers beyond all reckoning". A dubious claim, at best, but enough to pique my curiosity. He claims that with a few words, some odd hand motions and a stick I can create wands that project different kinds of force. Or was it energy? He was vague. If it's true then I can't turn down an unlimited source of practically free weapons. Still, something tells me this isn't quite as simple as it seems."

betterquesting.name: The Veil Of Reality
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange a gold ingot for an unusual weapon.** -"From what Roman's told me, a simple bar of gold and a short ritual is all it takes to summon and control Daemons. Monsters. I'll give it to him, his last magic trick was pretty impressive, but magic wands still aren't much compared to a shotguns and lasrifles. Regardless, this book of his clearly holds more than empty words. There is truth to it, and now the only question left to ask is how much."

betterquesting.name: Heart Of The Beast
betterquesting.desc: **Exchange a diamond for a Soulstone.** -"The summoning of Daemons is useful, but to truly call myself their master I must bind them to Soulstones, to be called upon at will. With these, I'll be able to keep my army of minions under tight control, only leaving them free when I need them and trapping them immediately after. All it takes is a diamond and some incantations."

betterquesting.name: The Summoner
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange a gold ingot for an unusual weapon.** -"Brining forth the malevolent entities known as Daemons from the warp is no simple task, it takes a great deal of concentration. Fortunately, there are a variety of ways of summoning the beasts, some preferable to others. I will need more than just one gold ingot, but it'll be worth it."

betterquesting.name: Keeper Of Secrets
betterquesting.desc: **Exchange steel and tough flesh for gold or Dust.** -"Through careful examination of the books I have stumbled upon a dark ritual that promises to bring great wealth. I will need 32 steel ingots and an offering of flesh, but if I understand the inscriptions correctly, I can make quantities of gold or Dust from the metal."

betterquesting.name: From Hells Heart
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with General Sarpedon.** -"General Sarpedon is the commander of what remains of Burke's army; in reality, nothing more than a motley collection of cultists, sycophants, mutants and outcasts. What they lack in cohesion they make up for in raw power and fanatical devotion, but it will take a truly extraordinary Champion to lead this rag-tag band to victory. I'm just the person for the job, and this Sarpedon is the man to talk to about it."

betterquesting.name: Gatekeeper
betterquesting.desc: **Locate survivors.** -Although the guard, a Corporal, apparently, seems somewhat dim-witted, you're none-the-less ecstatic to finally meet up with the Imperials. Perhaps there's some silver lining to this fiasco.

betterquesting.name: Down With The Ship
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with Captain Shadows.** -You're getting a strong impression that the Imperium's position on Mortua is a tenuous one. First, a dim-wit Corporal, and now this, a Captain with an official nickname. Whatever happened here certainly decimated the chain of command given the astounding lack of professionalism on display.

tasks.description: Speak with Captain Shadows and request a situation report.

betterquesting.name: Emergency Powers
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the elevator to the first level. Locate and speak with Francisco.** -After hearing of the trials and endless suffering of your comrades you feel a slight tinge of guilt at your earlier judgements. What they lack in professionalism they make up for in gumption. Their leaders may avoid summary execution after all.

tasks.description: Speak with Francisco and find out more about the fate of the Imperials.

betterquesting.name: Keys To The Soul
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with Drucilla.** -"Makko himself asked me to speak with this Drucilla character, so this must be important to someone. I should at least drop by and see what she's selling."

betterquesting.name: Dangerous Game
betterquesting.desc: **Access the Ad-Mech mainframe.** -The likelihood of getting caught hacking into the Imperium's preeminent IT expert's computer systems is high, high enough that you ought to be prepared to fight your way out when the situation devolves into violence. Given the severity of the crime, you probably won't be coming back, either.

betterquesting.name: Commercial Interests
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with Marco about a potentially peaceful solution to the foundry strike.** -Marco's ideas sound feasible, and it's hard to believe a man of his talent has gone unnoticed for so long. Once he sobers up he should be able to help turn the situation around in short order.

tasks.description: Speak with Marco about a peaceful solution to the strike.
Speak with Durkan about a peaceful solution to the strike.

betterquesting.name: Hard Landing
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some of your supplies.** -The ship may have been destroyed, but at least chunks of it managed to make it through the atmosphere. Combing through a piece of wreckage, you notice a military crate and wonder if the supplies are still functional.

betterquesting.name: Castaway
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some of your supplies.** -The hunk of ship must have been thrown off in this direction after the blast. If there are supplies in it they'll come in handy.

betterquesting.name: The Alpha
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain a modern workbench.** -Endel and Rezz weren't joking about the size of the info-dump; it's going to take weeks to sort through all of it. In a broad sense, it's a road-map of technological achievements, as well as the instructions for building and operating a staggering amount of machinery. Endel's also added some notes of a more personal nature to explain his plan, and generally keep you apprised of the situation..."The modern workbench is stocked with all the basic tools you'll need to make just about anything. As a plus, it's blast resistant and stain proof."

betterquesting.name: Baby's First Industry
betterquesting.desc: **Craft some basic blocks and items.** -"Build a furnace, a chest, a forge hammer and an Engineer's hammer. The forge hammer is used to work with metal and the Engineer's hammer is used to assemble most multi-block machines."

betterquesting.name: The Riddle Of Steel
betterquesting.desc: **Craft Blast Bricks, construct a Crude Blast Furnace and make steel.** -"You're probably wondering why you would want to make your own steel when there's so much that can be salvaged. Well, unless you plan on leading a nomadic existence, you'll eventually run out of buildings to break down. Besides, the process behind making steel is simple. First, you'll need a Blast Furnace, even if it's a crude version of one. The bricks require a refractory coating, so you'll need bauxite dust, something that can be found by smashing up clumps of bauxite or lateritic soil. You can find both all over Mortua, but you may want to grab the convenient surface deposits first. Once you have the bricks you just consult your Engineer's Manual to see how it's assembled. After that, insert your coke and iron and wait for the magic to happen."

betterquesting.name: Heavy Mettle
betterquesting.desc: **Craft Coke Oven Bricks, construct a Coke Oven and make coke.** -"Steel requires a pure source of carbon, like charcoal or coal coke, and the Coke Oven can make both. The byproduct of the process is creosote, which gathers in an internal tank. The creosote may have limited use as a fuel, but later on you can blend it with other fuels to make a sort of low-grade promethium, so hold on to it. Consult your Engineer's Manual to see how to assemble the oven. As for the materials that go into the bricks, clay can be found everywhere on Mortua, it's just dried up. You'll need some water to re-hydrate it, so you'll probably want to stay near a water source. Bauxite dust can be found in bauxite or lateritic soil clumps, but you'll need a lot of it for the refractory coating. Dried clay, bauxite and lateritic soil all occur on the surface, so look for the dark patches of desert. Any kind of cobble can be used, so just dig down. Finally, make sure the creosote tank doesn't fill up, even if it means scooping the liquid out with bottles. If it does, your oven will cease to operate."

betterquesting.name: Industrial Rage
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the Mk.I Processors.** -"Once you have electricity and a decent supply of steel it's time to start building some basic mark one machinery. The Material Processor lets you double your ore output, among other things. The Chemical Processor will give you the ability to create many different chemicals, and generally alter materials on a chemical level. The Mechanical Processor allows you to work metals and craft different components. Finally, the Electric Furnace lets you smelt without fuel. All the machines require electricity. If you're curious, the interface panel for the machinery can list all the tasks the machines can complete, just click around the progress bar and you'll find it."

betterquesting.name: Batteries Not Included
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Mk. I Battbox.** -"Energy must have somewhere to go after it's produced, or else it goes to waste. You can either spend it by doing work or store it using batteries. The Mk.I Battbox should be good, for now."

betterquesting.name: Iron Will
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a set of iron tools.** -"Iron tools are still used by many citizens of the Imperium to this day. Speaks volumes about where we're at."

betterquesting.name: Stone Age
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a set of stone tools.** -"Like the wooden tools, you'll build these only out of necessity and replace them as soon as you get something better. Also, remember that different types of stone have different levels of hardness, and weak stone will make weak tools."

betterquesting.name: Diversified Assets
betterquesting.desc: **Craft basic generators.** "You're going to need some way to generate electricity in the first place.
