Craft a Generator Mk.I, a Kinetic Dynamo, a windmill blade and a Photovoltaic Panel. The Generator Mk. I is a universal steam turbine: it accepts just about any fuel and is incredibly efficient. The Kinetic Dynamo, when paired with the windmill blade, can produce steady amounts of electricity at a decent altitude. The Photovoltaic Panel produces very little energy, but as long as the sun can reach it you can expect it to trickle out some electricity. Once you have them all set up you'll have a source of electricity for every occasion, just make sure to keep some fuel on hand for that generator."

betterquesting.name: Power Up
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks and items that make up your electric infrastructure.** -"If you really want to get anything done you'll need electricity, and lots of it. Start off with the basics, lines, wire connectors and a wrench. Keep in mind that the string wires and block wires are very different. The blocky power lines carry a form of electricity called EU, which is mostly used by the basic machines and generators. The stringy lines carry a form of electricity called RF, which is used by the machines listed in your Engineer's Manual. EU machines accept RF, but only through the wire connectors. RF machines do not accept EU through the blocky cables, but wire connectors can be placed on blocky cables to transform EU to RF mode. It's a little confusing, but you'll find machines noted with the type of electricity they use, so keep an eye on your tooltips."

betterquesting.name: Bronze God
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a set of bronze tools.** -"Ancient humans went through a bronze age because they had no idea how to work iron. You on the other hand benefit from hindsight, so you'll probably make iron tools before bronze tools. However, if you're in the mood to revisit the time honored tradition of toiling in ignorance I'll happily humor you."

betterquesting.name: Factorum
betterquesting.desc: **Craft several automation machines.** "Whenever you have a repetitive yet simple task that you'll need to invest a significant amount of time into, you may want to consider automating it. These machines will help you in your quest for the ideal factorum, but each fulfills a different purpose either mechanically or aesthetically. If you prefer function over form, use the itemducts or the electric sorting machine. Itemducts can transport materials between machines and storage but will require some extra parts to work. The electric sorting machine is easier to configure for small jobs, but requires power. Finally, the conveyor belts look sharp, but are somewhat more complicated to use and set up. One thing that I highly recommend is the Machinist's Workbench. A dozen or so of those each configured to produce ubiquitous parts like circuits or motors makes any production task much less complicated as you no longer have to remember recipes."

betterquesting.name: Early Man Walked Away
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a set of wood tools.** -"Everyone has to start somewhere. You can find the wood to make these easy enough, just break down some scrawny creosote trees. Only useful up until the point that you some stone to make better tools with."

betterquesting.name: Real Steel
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a set of steel tools.** -"These tools are actually pretty damn good, considering they aren't powered. You may even be able to do some things with these that you can't do with power tools, depending on how experienced you are."

betterquesting.name: Fluid Exchange
betterquesting.desc: **Craft several machines for transporting fluids.** -"Working with oil, water and lava on any large scale will necessitate the use of pumps and pipes. The pump itself has two mods: basic and advanced - swap them by crafting it. Basic mode will move only fluid directly underneath the pump, a feature that's only useful in certain situations. Advanced mode is much more powerful, and can draw fluids from large reservoirs. Advanced mode can also interface with pipes, which can then move the fluid that's being pumped to storage. Make sure to consult the Engineer's Manual for instructions on how to assemble advanced pumps, pipes and storage tanks."

betterquesting.name: Force Of Nature
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Modern Blast Furnace and some Heat Generators.** -"By now you've used the crude blast furnace, perhaps the improved one as well, but what about something that needs neither fuel nor coke? The Modern Blast Furnace requires only heat, iron and compressed air; air that has been pumped into a container under pressure. To obtain a Compressed Air Cell simply place an Empty Cell into a Mechanical Processor Mk.I. To assemble the furnace, place a heat generator behind it so that the heating element is facing the furnace. You can generate heat several different ways, but electrically may the the simplest."

betterquesting.name: That Feeling
betterquesting.desc: **Examine the room for more information about the alleged perpetrator.** -"I was always stressed out in the Arbites. It wasn't like being a Commissar, where I could carry out punishments on a whim, it was more suffocating. It was like I knew how the case would play out before I even read the brief. I chalked it up to instinct, of course, and brushed the notion off. There was something off, though. My damn instincts were more thorough than the entire force."

betterquesting.name: Modern Man Took Control
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Mining Drill Mk.I.** -"Power tools are much better than their manual predecessors, the downside being that they require energy, so you'll have to recharge them after heavy usage. It's not a bad trade off considering their more robust construction means you will never have to repair them, and once upgraded they are significantly faster than steel tools."

betterquesting.name: Diesel Power
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for a Diesel Generator and construct it.** -"You may have noticed by now that promethium is more energy dense than most generators can truly appreciate. This is where the diesel generator comes in. It's a very old technology that's seen a thousand revisions, but it was still used by our ancestors up until the time of Mortua's golden age. It is, of course, extremely costly, but it's worth it if your burning a lot of promethium and have tremendous electricity requirements. Again, you'll need to consult your Engineer's Manual to see how to put it all together."

betterquesting.name: Standard Template Conduct
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for a Mechanical Processor Mk.III and construct it.** -"The Mechanical Processor Mk.III is the holy grail of machines. It's what countless explorator fleets have willingly plunged into the yawning abyss for. It has driven Tech-Priests mad in their desperate quest to restore mankind to it's former glory. It can, much like the Chem Processor Mk.III, manufacture sophisticated objects from basic raw materials, but in this case it's creating parts and machines. It only requires the instructions, or STC, and the resources and electricity to operate."

betterquesting.name: Age Of Mechanicus
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the Mk.II processors.** -"The Mk.II processors represent significant upgrades from their Mk.I kin. The Chemial Processor Mk.II is not only able to amplify your ore output, but it's the only machine capable of turning lesser substances into ceramite and adamantium. The Mechanical Processor Mk.II is an integral part of any modern machine shop, and without it you will be unable to craft some of the more advanced Mortuan tech. Finally, the Electric Furnace Mk.II is built for smelting industrial quantities of ore. It operates at a rapid rate once it reaches it's optimum operational temperature. The downside is that it constantly uses power while it's being heated, which can be very inefficient during idle periods."

betterquesting.name: High Voltage
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks and items that make up your high voltage electric infrastructure.** -"You probably have enough experience working with electricity by now to move on to the higher voltages. Honestly, I don't recommend using them unless you are trying to move electricity over very long distances, and in that case you may want to consider redesigning your base to reflect your logistical situation."

betterquesting.name: Melting Pot
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for an Arc Furnace and construct it.** -"The Arc Furnace is a hulking monstrosity that can turn ore into molten metal in a flash. This thing can melt just about anything but ceramite, and it operates at a pace that can be described as "break-neck". Not only can it do the job of ten furnaces, but it can also purify certain metals, allowing you to skip the washing process entirely. You are also unable to process aluminum without it, so once you have it running you'll be inundated with a new source of metal."

betterquesting.name: Crunch Time
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for a Crusher and construct it.** -"The crusher is a massive, room-sized machine capable of shredding just about anything you feed into it. It's essentially an upgraded material processor, but it's capable of so much more, and at much greater speeds. The drawbacks, size excluded, are it's tremendous rate of electricity consumption and the simple fact that you'll probably never need so much capacity. To operate it you must dump the blocks and items you wish to process into the teeth-like grinders situated at the top of the machine. Don't fall in!"

betterquesting.name: The Power Of Hellfire
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Geothermal Generator.** -"You've managed to harness wind, steam and photons to produce electricity, so it makes sense that we'd move on to lava. The geothermal generator let's you generate electricity from the heat that molten rock emits as it cools. Mortua's still tectonically active, so you can expect to find more lava the deeper you go. Still, compared to other means of generation, you'll be hard pressed to find a sustainable source outside of a giant volcano."

betterquesting.name: Nice Meltdown
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Nuclear Reactor, reactor components and a hazmat suit.** -"You've harnessed the power of the elements, and you've probably found them wanting, much as our ancestors did. Splitting the atom can be considered one of the greatest scientific achievements of all time, mostly because it's a big step up in terms of generating stupendous amounts of electricity. Reactors are made up of a central chamber and a number of optional chambers that can be attached to it's sides. The more chambers you have, the more components you can fit inside, which means more electricity with less uranium. Sure, there are risks, but as long as you're careful and informed, you'll be fine."

betterquesting.name: Residue Processing
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the Material Washer and the Recycler.** -"In case you can somehow gain access to a nearly unlimited source of water, you can stretch your ore supplies out by washing them in the Material Washer. You'll also need it to make nitrocellulose, if firearms are your thing. The Recycler, while largely useless on its own, may come in handy down the road. For now, it's just to turn your unwanted stuff into something you can burn."

betterquesting.name: Some Assembly Required
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for an Assembler and construct it.** -"The Assembler is a self-contained factory. Provide it with basic instructions and raw materials and it can assemble anything you can. It does require electricity, but time is more valuable anyway, and this thing will save you loads of it. It is a multi-block machine, so you'll need to consult the Engineer's Manual to see how it's built."

betterquesting.name: The Miraculous Magnet
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for a magnetic firepole and construct it.** "Allegedly, a crude elevator can be constructed using iron poles, a magnetizing device, and iron boots. How this could be viewed as a feasible substitute for a real elevator is beyond me, but I imagine our ancestors had quite the sense of humor to design such an impractical mode of vertical travel."

betterquesting.name: Rise Of The Machines
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks and items for an Auto-Miner Mk.I.** -"The Auto-Miner Mk.I is an amazing piece of technology. It will systematically mine an area of variable dimensions straight down to bedrock, plucking out all the valuable ore it finds along the way. It can be a little cumbersome to set up, but you should ideally have a couple of these going at any given time. If you use six or more you no longer really need to mine by hand at all. Load it up with an Ore Detector Mk.II or one of the more advanced drills and it will mine out a bigger area at a much faster rate. I really can't stress how useful these are. Let me just put it this way: if you use them right, you won't have to worry about ore anymore."

betterquesting.name: Ever-Ready
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Charging Pad Mk.I and a Charging Station.** - "The charging pad configuration of batt-boxes lets you charge the EU-capable devices in your armor slots and inventory simply by standing on it. The Charging Station, on the other hand, requires that the chargeable item in question be placed inside it, where it's recharged at an extremely rapid rate. It's one attractive machine, and the obvious choice for both practical and aesthetic reasons, so of course it only accepts RF."

betterquesting.name: Planet Cracker
betterquesting.desc: **Craft an Auto-Miner Mk.II.** -"This model of auto-miner is capable of strip mining large volumes in record time. It's simple to set up, requires no internal components, and depending on the mode, can be configured to target specific blocks. It does require a reservoir of electricity to operate, but it's simplicity of use and the fact that it does as much work as four Mk.I's make it an essential machine if you plan to mine large quantities of ore."

betterquesting.name: Infiniminer
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Mining Laser.** -"Mining lasers are usually employed when speed is the primary consideration. There are multiple modes of fire which can be toggled by a configurable button. The enormous power draw of the mining laser is it's main setback, but long-range shots can be worth it."

betterquesting.name: Growing Pains
betterquesting.desc: **Craft containers and upgrade modules.** "Once you start cringing at the sound of opening chests you know it's time for a more efficient storage system. Strongboxes are cheap, expandable, blast-resistant and similar to the chest, so you don't even have to leave your comfort zone. Cache's can only hold one type of item, but they can hold it in tremendous quantities. Tanks are like caches but for liquids. Once you upgrade your storage, you may also want to consider upgrading your machine shop. Overclockers can help speed up machines at the cost of extra electricity, while storage upgrades speak for themselves."

betterquesting.name: Excited State
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Mk.IV Batt-Box.** -"This is it, the apex of energy storage technology. If the wider Imperium of Man were to get its hands on this magnificent piece of archeotech, power fluctuations and brownouts would be a thing of the past. Almost necessary once you have things like nuclear reactors and diesel generators running."

betterquesting.name: Chemicals And Circuitry
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for a Chemical Processor Mk.III and construct it.** -"The Chemical Processor Mk.III is one hell of a machine. Far in advance of even the most exotic of Ad-Mech machines, this thing can pull water right out of the air to use in its reactions, it can refine oil directly into promethium at a more efficient rate than its predecessor, and it can even make some advanced substances from basic raw ingredients. You may need to find some STCs to enable that last bit of functionality, though."

betterquesting.name: Refined Tastes
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for a refinery and construct it.** -"The Refinery is not strictly necessary to create promethium, as the Chem Processors Mk.II and III cover that. Instead, the refinery can multiply your supply of promethium by blending oils with other volatile liquids and somehow making much more promethium than normal. If you are really hard up for promethium, or have lots of ethanol, plant oils or creosote sitting around, go ahead and check it out."

betterquesting.name: Nightmare Machine
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks and items for a warp micro-network and construct it.** -"The warp is a vast, frightening dimension, brimming with nightmare creatures that have waited an eternity for the moment when they can tear their way into our universe. Ancient man knew this, but could not pass up the potential of harnessing the power of that dark place, and so we have warp travel, Gellar fields, navigators and now this: warp micro-networks. These networks harness the power of the warp to store and move objects over vast distances in an instant. What does this mean? It means we can build entire factory complexes in a space no bigger than a small building. Just pray to the Omnissiah that the adamantium and ceramite shielding holds, and nothing breaks through."

betterquesting.name: Terminal Velocity
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks and items for interfacing with the micro-network.** -"Based off the contents of the data readouts I've studied, it appears as if there were several ways to interface with the micro-network. The Interface Terminal itself is capable of mapping the network, and will display all the various machines connected to it. The Crafting Terminal combines the Interface Terminal with a crafting station, allowing users to assemble things using items pulled from network storage. Finally, the Pattern Terminal allows users to save recipes or processing chains. You'll need a Blank Pattern to do either, but the device is necessary for the automatic assembly of parts drawn from the network. Taken together, these terminals will grant you the ability to fine-tune your network."

betterquesting.name: Short Bus
betterquesting.desc: **Craft Bus blocks.** -"Busses allow the network to interface with your machines, chests, barrels and caches. This expands the network to include storage in real-space and enables fully integrated workshops, where you can stand at an interface panel and assign ore to be processed or circuits to be made with the touch of a button."

betterquesting.name: Currents In The Stream
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Controller, an IO Port and some Dense Warp Conduit.** -"Once you have more than eight devices on a network, you'll need a Controller. It will also help to have some Dense Warp Conduit to carry the extra channels the controller will give you. You should also consider crafting yourself an IO port. It's the least cumbersome interface for managing the objects in the network."

betterquesting.name: Interdimensional Interface
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks and items for expanding the micro-network.** -"Now that you've seen what the network can do, you might want to check out some devices that you can expand it with. The Warp Conduit is the first step to linking multiple devices to the network. It transfers both data and electricity for the devices, and has eight channels, a feature I'll discuss later. The ME Drive is capable of holding up to ten storage cells, but it's useless on it's own; it must be attached to a network to operate. The machine also draws copious amounts of electricity, likely a result of having to project a stable void into the warp. The ME Terminal is an essential device which allows you to search, sort and apply a filtered view of the contents of the network. In short: it shows you all the things you've stuff into your drives. You'll need a View Cell to apply filters, but they're not too much of a hassle to make. Finally, if you don't like the look of those bare Warp Conduits you can throw on some metal, giving them a more robust appearance. It's an aesthetic choice and will have no effect on their operation."

betterquesting.name: Power Point
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the P2P Tunnels.** -"The Point to Point Tunnels let you move objects into and out of the network as if it was an extension of a pipe, or a conveyor belt. That's not really that useful in and of itself, but it can also carry channels, up to 32 of them, over a single channel. Once you hit this level of complexity, I'm guessing your network can assemble almost anything."

betterquesting.name: Quantum Leap
betterquesting.desc: **Craft eight Quantum Ring blocks and give them to Endel.** -"Please meet me at the Ad-Mech bunker. It's urgent."

betterquesting.name: Core Contingency
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for a Core Sample Drill and construct it.** -"Building a core sample drill is the first step toward accessing the vast swath of stratum normally unavailable to organic mining units. This is a good thing, considering our extensive and exhaustive geological evaluation of the planet determined that there is are substantial amounts of ore nestled within Mortua. First, you need to set up a Core Sample Drill and power it to get an idea of what you can can haul up from any given chunk. After all, you don't want to go through all that trouble to get lapis lazuli, or some other trite thing."

betterquesting.name: Hot Storage
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Batt-Box Mk.II.** -"Unless you're very industrious, then I'm sure that you've noticed that lots of electricity goes to waste. Invest in one of these to mitigate that issue, for now."

betterquesting.name: China Syndrome
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks and items for improving the Nuclear Reactor.** -"Reactors can be run as self-contained units, as I'm sure you've noticed. However, they suffer a 50% drop in efficiency in that mode. Fortunately, we possess the instructions for building a much more efficient reactor. The only downside is the investment in capital: you'll need to construct a shell, manufacture coolant at a steady rate, and set up a steam turbine and generator system."

betterquesting.name: Water From A Stone
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Liquid Heat Exchanger.** -"If you're really obsessed with efficiency, you can run hot coolant through one of these. It will allow you to capture the energy of some of that waste heat and turn it into even more electricity via the Stirling Generator."

betterquesting.name: Old Becomes New
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for an Advanced Wind Turbine and construct it.** -"I know you've already built a wind turbine, but that antique is primitive in comparison to this model. This unit, when positioned well, can produce enormous amounts of electricity. The downsides are that it's difficult to construct and that its blades tend to wear out over time. That's fine though, because with the Crusher at hand you can chuck them in and recoup most of your losses. Get building!"

betterquesting.name: Logic Engine
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the machines for manufacturing custom logic chips.** -"This is truly an optional thing, so just disregard it unless you're a completionist. I'm sure you have a little experience with logic tiles, you know, Timers, Repeaters, things like that. Well, these devices let you design and create your own custom logic tiles. Internally, they can contain many different gates, but externally they will take up the same amount of space as one tile."

betterquesting.name: A Thousand Suns
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Batt-Box Mk.III.** -"The Batt-Box Mk.III is the logical progression in the Batt-Box series. Like its fore-bearers, it stores electricity until it's needed, saving you precious juice for the lean times."

betterquesting.name: E=MC2
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the machines for transforming electricity into matter.** -"This is the pinnacle of Mortuan manufacturing tech. Once you have these machines you can convert energy directly into matter and then configure that matter into anything you can scan. Of course this takes stupendous amounts of energy, but what did you expect from something that allows you to bypass all conventional means of production. Only recommended for duplicating the rare or unique."

betterquesting.name: The Wire
betterquesting.desc: **Craft blocks for working with signals.** -"Sometimes you need small amounts of electricity to send arbitrary signals to your machines and equipment. When it comes to that, you can always just use Dust, if you don't mind throwing it on the ground like a filthy animal, or, stay with me here, you can make some Signal Wires. Signal Wires are more versatile, can be color coded or bundled to isolate signals from each other, and can be placed on walls and ceilings. Try them, you won't look back."

betterquesting.name: Homebrew
betterquesting.desc: **Craft blocks for making your own fuel and quartz.** -"If you have a lot of excess biomass sitting around then you can either let it rot into nothing or use it for Biogas. Biogas can be burned for small amounts of electricity and gives you something to do with all those leftovers. You should also look into growing purified quartz. Yes, it's possible to grow quartz: all you need is water, electricity, seed crystals and lots of time."

betterquesting.name: Pipe Dreams
betterquesting.desc: **Craft blocks for moving objects.** -"Warp Ducts are simply more advanced Item Ducts: they can move objects much faster and in greater volume, the cost being the main drawback. Hardened Fluid Ducts work much the same way, but with fluids. In either case you'll still need Servos and Retrievers to have them interface with your storage in any meaningful way."

betterquesting.name: MOHO Menace
betterquesting.desc: **Craft the blocks for an Excavator and construct it.** -"The Excavator is a giant, power-hungry machine that lets you bore deep into a planet to pick out ores and other valuables. You should have already used the Core Drill on a couple chunks to see what lies under the surface, so set up and Excavator there. Don't forget to consult your engineers manual to see how this thing is built. On a more whimsical note, I can't help but mention that this thing looks like it has a bucket wheel on it. I'm not sure how that worked its way into such an advanced machines, but I think the ancients might have been feeling a little nostalgic."

betterquesting.name: Top Drill
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Mining Drill Mk.IV.** -"This ancient design relies on sheer mechanical force to excavate as much as possible. With the 3x3 upgrade the thing lets you chew through terrain faster than an auto-miner. The only downside, other than the initial material requirement, is the enormous amount of electricity it burns through. Have fun."

betterquesting.name: In The Sky With Diamonds
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Mining Drill Mk.II.** -"A little diamond and your drill can mine much harder materials at an even greater rate."

betterquesting.name: Ultradense Materials
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Mining Drill Mk.III.** -"If you can actually craft a drill of this quality, congratulations; you have now overtaken the Ad-Mech itself in terms of technological know-how. Don't get me wrong, we can manufacture drills like this one. The catch is that it takes us weeks, not hours."

betterquesting.name: Save The Trees
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain saplings and cellulux stalks.** -"I'm sure you noticed the complete lack of trees around here. Unless you stumble upon a jungle, that's the norm for Mortua. The biosphere here is dead and buried, with tiny bits holding on here and there, but nothing to write home about. If you need a steady supply of lumber, you'll be planting forests yourself. The good news is that the GE trees we brought with us take to this soil like mold to a damp sponge, so it shouldn't be very long at all before you have a green acre of your own."

betterquesting.name: Elastic Commodities
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain rubber tree saplings and raw rubber.** -"In the grimdark of the far future we still need raw rubber. Yes, we can make synthetic rubber, but even that requires a small amount of the natural stuff. Establish a rubber plantation: it doesn't have to be huge because there are several ways to multiply your supply."

betterquesting.name: Crop Science
betterquesting.desc: **Craft farming tools.** -"I'm sure you have a little experience with traditional farming, having likely come from an overcrowded hive world. Oh, you don't? What a surprise. Anyway, things have changed a little since the good ol' days of just plopping a seed in the soil. Now we have all these fancy things, like lineage and genetics, to factor in. Go ahead and craft this equipment, and from now on start taking a better look at your seeds. You can actually improve their yield through careful management. If you're lucky, you may even unlock some ancient crossbreed with insanely rare or valuable qualities. It wouldn't be the first time that happened here."

betterquesting.name: Up In Smoke
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain hemp seeds.** -"You'll need access to some tough, natural fibers for basic things such as wood pulp and rope. Now, you can always get wool from those pathetic looking creatures that crawl around on their horns, and you can get wood pulp from clear-cutting jungles, or you can grow hemp. Can you guess what I would suggest doing?"

betterquesting.name: Life Finds A Way
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain seeds from natural plants.** -"Despite the fact that it's a dessicated wasteland, this planet actually does have some green places. Look for a jungle and till the grass there until you rummage up some seeds for the most basic crops. Then, find some mushrooms and get their spores. Shouldn't be hard, damn things are everywhere."

betterquesting.name: Intermission
betterquesting.desc: **Craft tools to farm and a block for sorting seeds.** -"You've worked pretty hard so far, and you've learned more about Mortua's flora than any of us has. You'll be moving on to some more difficult breeds soon, so take a moment to consolidate your gains and move past using those old tools to till soil and sort seeds."

betterquesting.name: Late Bloomers
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain seeds from industrial plants.** -"You would think that growing nuggets of ore on plants was a joke, or that it was some impossible feat. It's not. Somehow, these plants can send roots deep into the ground, feeling out pockets of ores and minerals. The roots form a vast network that can pump what they find to the surface in small quantities. It's science that has become indistinguishable from magic."

betterquesting.name: Strange Growth
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain seeds from more advanced industrial plants.** -"These plants and fungi will let you start tapping into the real potential of Mortuan flora.  Breed these crops in volume and you won't be as pressed for resources."

betterquesting.name: Crossbred To Bear
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain seeds from dye plants.** -"Industrial crops were an ancient Mortuan attempt to turn the forces of nature into a means of production. The traits of those old breeds have mingled and receded into the background overtime, but you'd better believe they still persist in every living plant on this planet. To coax them out, we must first learn to program more basic plants to concentrate certain substances in their leaves, flowers or seeds. The first step in this process is to unlock the unassuming dye plants by crossbreeding natural ones."

betterquesting.name: Garden Of Eden
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain seeds from apex industrial plants.** -"It's obvious why plants that grow copper are so valuable, and I hope by now you understand what it means to have access to a near-infinite source of Dust. Regardless, this is the end of the line when it comes to genetics, but who knows what secrets the future yet holds."

betterquesting.name: Tools Of The Trade
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Powered Treetap and a sickle.** -"Instead of wasting resources on crude, wooden treetaps you could build one of these. Like all power tools it will not break, but it must be recharged. Another useful tool for any farmer is the sickle. It lets you harvest crops in a large area, saving countless hours."

betterquesting.name: Another Brick In The Wall
betterquesting.desc: **Loot 32 Rockcrete from wasteland buildings.** -"Rockcrete is your best defense against the monsters that roam the wasteland. I'm talking about those drooling beasts, by the way. Actual people will be smart enough to get past it without much consideration."

betterquesting.name: Mister Sandman
betterquesting.desc: **Loot a bed.** -"First, I just want to say I'm sorry. It's not my intent to come off as a misanthrope, it's just a result of seeing so much loss and pain. Anyway, I'm here to help you. Follow my advice, and not only will you earn some credits, but you'll live longer. Trust me, before I linked up with Endel and the rest of my comrades, I learned all this from experience. Now, first thing's first. You need a bed to set your respawn point, so get one as soon as possible and set it up in a SAFE location."

betterquesting.name: Tesla Power
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Tesla Coil and a Batt-Box Mk.I.** -"A Tesla coil is an effective way to kill things if you've got leftover electricity or just want to keep a small area clear. It will hit every target in a 9x9x9 area, but does come with a large power draw. Build it on top of a Mk.I Batt-Box and rig it up with some pressure plates to only activate when mobs are near."

betterquesting.name: The Emperor's Light
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Powered Lantern, LV Wire and an LV Wire Connector.** -"I don't know what it is, but there's just something about the soft, warm glow of an old fashioned powered lamp. You know what I mean."

tasks.description: speak with wilco about his guide

betterquesting.name: The Light Fantastic
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain lighting.** -"Torches certainly have an appealing aesthetic, but they're not a wise choice for the practical survivor. Instead, I suggest these Small Lights for informal applications and the block lights for everything else."

betterquesting.name: Enemy At The Gates
betterquesting.desc: **Loot various objects for fortifying your residence.** -"You can build yourself a well protected residence with Rockcrete, but what about the doors and windows? There are solutions other than just cutting big holes in everything, and here are a few."

betterquesting.name: Defense In Depth
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain Reinforced Rockcrete, Chain Link Fence, Barbed Wire, a Remote Viewer and Wire Cutters.** -"Reinforced Rockcrete is a nightmare to mine, and it's impervious to conventional explosives. Wire Fence is pretty sturdy in it's own way, too; you can really only cut through it with wire cutters. Barbed Wire is a nuisance at the least and a lethal trap at the worst. Finally, get yourself a Remote Viewer. It's pretty interesting technology, and a good way of evaluating what's behind a wall without exposing yourself."

betterquesting.name: Turrets Syndrome
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a 12mm Turret, a Projectile Turret Base, and 64 12mm Rounds.** -"Listen: the best way to defend an area is, by far, with static defenses: Rockcrete, Reinforced Steel Doors, Barbed Wire, and so on. However, if you want to do a little more than huddle inside while the bloodthirsty masses heave themselves at your walls, you'll need to start using some automated weaponry to keep your perimeter clear. These turrets are your best bet. They have great range, they're almost impossible for entities to damage, and they lay down withering hails of fire. The only drawback is their small power draw and the ammunition costs."

betterquesting.name: Laser Focus
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Long-Las Turret and an Energy Turret Base.** -"The Long-Las Turret is just an automated Long-Las, with the exception being that it draws power from the turret's base instead of EC Packs. This means you never have to worry about ammunition for it, just run some wires and be done."

betterquesting.name: Overkiller
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Rocket Turret and turret add-ons.** -"The rocket turret is the most expensive option when it comes to home defense. The rockets are grossly overpowered against anything but the largest entities, but if you can afford them, why not. The add-ons may help with improving your existing turrets, so they come highly recommended. On another note, it looks like your at the end of the line, now. If you've taken my advice to heart you should be fairly well off, but in case you aren't, I'm sending you something that might help a bit."

betterquesting.name: Warped View
betterquesting.desc: **Craft Monitors.** -"Monitors allow you to view network activities at a glance, or perform simple input and output operations. They're really just an accessory, though, and all your heavy lifting will be done elsewhere."

betterquesting.name: Turn It Off And On Again
betterquesting.desc: **Craft micro-network management tools.** -"If your micro-network needs some trouble-shooting, these tools will come in handy. They will also let you configure some things easier, and you'll probably want them just for that."

betterquesting.name: Upgrade Complete
betterquesting.desc: **Craft upgrade cards for micro-network machines.** -"Basic cards provide extra functionality to most network machines. Nothing special. Advanced cards are capable of really changing how network machines work; they're even capable of making them operate faster."

betterquesting.name: And The Omega
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Matter Condenser and use it to make a Singularity.** -"Only in my wildest, most fantastical dreams had I begun to imagine that we may one day again ascend to the heights of our ancestors. Until now we were humble peasants chanting and bickering among the ruins of a society that dwarfed ours in every respect. Now, we stand at shoulder level to that great civilization that spanned the stars and feared neither the alien nor the witch. We've come a long way, you and I. It's time to finish this, Colonel. While I don't understand it's workings, I believe that the Matter Condenser concentrates energy into some form of exotic matter and then holds it all together inside a magnetic containment field. Regardless, the result is a stable micro-singularity which I intend to use as a sort of quantum transmitter."

betterquesting.name: Hell Is Other People
betterquesting.desc: **Craft a Safe and a Code Door.** -"If your up against human opponents, all you can really do is hope to slow them down or persuade them to bother someone less prepared than yourself. So, here's what you do: make yourself some code doors and safes. Keep your real important items in the safe, and use the code doors and Rockcrete to do the persuading."

betterquesting.name: Small Guns 10
betterquesting.desc: A score of 10 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Under Siege
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the entrance to Last Chance.** Last Chance was a town established by former convicts - men and women lucky enough to survive a tour of duty in the penal legions. In exchange for their service they were given their freedom, and the same opportunity any guardsman would receive: the chance to make a life on a newly conquered world. These bastards were unlucky enough to wind up on the ship headed to Mortua, but being the enterprising sort they quickly carved out a niche for themselves.                                                                                  Settling an isolated mountain near an evaporated sea, they took to mining the dried up bed for it's deposits of valuable minerals. They were well on their way to making Last Chance a prosperous little settlement when the event happened. However, the Last Chancer's were a robust group, and they did not go quiet, instead fortifying their mountain home and steeling their resolve to keep the entities at bay. It seems they held out for some time, but in the end ultimately fell to a more familiar threat: humans.                                                                                        After a lengthy siege, a band of raiders have occupied the town and slaughtered or enslaved most of it's inhabitants. The settlers that got away have taken shelter in the town hall, but their supplies are running low, and recently all radio broadcasts have ceased. They need help, and fast, but care must be taken when approaching the town: there are snipers.

betterquesting.name: Aluminium?
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically create aluminum using bauxite dust and Dust.** -"As your understanding of electrical and mechanical principles has grown, so to has your ability to control the Dust. You now have to ability to transform bauxite into aluminum, with the Dust acting as a catalyst. This ability is mentally exhausting, and can only be used periodically."

betterquesting.name: Future Tech
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically create Plasteel using steel plates and Dust.** -"Through the understanding of more advanced principles of physics and metallurgy, the path to unlocking a certain pliability in steel unfolds before you. You now have a firm grasp on this revolutionary material, and can occasionally, with the aid of Dust, bend your will to transform simple steel into Plasteel."

betterquesting.name: Rock Steady
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically create Ceramite using glass and Dust.** -"A miraculous material capable of dispelling overwhelming amounts of energy with ease, Ceramite is valued in the construction, electronics and defense industries. Having yourself become familiar with the material, you now possess the ability to synthesize it from mere glass and Dust. Though the process taxes your nerves, the ease with which you can now produce this valuable material outweighs the costs."

betterquesting.name: Liquid Fire
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically create promethium using water cells and Dust.** -"A catch-all term for a wide variety of fuels that can be burned in rugged Imperial engines, Promethium has traits peculiar to whichever refinery may be producing it. It so happens that the local stock is some of the most potent you've ever set upon, and after prolonged contact, it's like you have some innate grasp of the chemistry of the stuff. With a little Dust, a lot of focus, some water and and plenty of cellulux, you think you can occasionally create a batch by sheer force of will."

betterquesting.name: Wild Growth
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically create logs using Dust.** -"Even on a planet as desolate as Mortua, life has found a way. Knowing the nature of the Dust, this simple fact does not surprise you, and over time you develop the sensation that creating life itself from barren rock is a simple affair. Dust in hand, you strain your mind, forging a picture of a wealth of lumber before you. Before your eyes, vines burst from the ground, fattening at a gross rate. Just as you fear they will consume you the growth falters and the bases of the roots wither to dust, leaving you with clumps of wood."

betterquesting.name: Master At Arms
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically create Nitrocellulose, RDX or Composite Propellant using Dust.** -"Your mastery of weaponry, defensive and offensive, has its perks. Now that you know these systems inside and out, you've developed the ability to manipulate Dust into turning raw materials into all sorts of useful explosives and propellants. The feat will leave you spent, of course, so you'll need to take breaks in between its uses."

betterquesting.name: Verdant Designs
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically create fertilizer at will.** -"To create life is no small feat, and to foster its hold in a place such as Mortua requires a unique spirit. Through time, you've found that this spirit allows you to use the Dust to pull valuable nutrients from lifeless rock. Having learned this secret, you will be forever blessed with bountiful harvests."

betterquesting.name: Not Enough Chests
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically create a Resonant Cache, Resonant Tank or Resonant Strongbox at will.** -"Resonant storage blocks can hold far more material than their perceived volume would indicate. Your deep-seated desire for more storage space must have been picked up on by the Dust, as you now find yourself able to create spacious vessels from what amounts to very little."

betterquesting.name: Can't Fight City Hall
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the city hall and kill the raiders inside.** The Last Chancer's must have always planned to fall back to the city hall in case of an emergency, because the place is more like a fortress than a civic center. The raiders downstairs will still need taken care to give the beleaguered defenders a break.

betterquesting.name: They Shot The Sheriff
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with Deputy Dewey.** After the raiders killed the sheriff the deputies were left leaderless and demoralized. It took someone like Dewey to pull them back together, and that they have. They still have no chance, but they'll fight to the bitter end. Hopefully, there's another way.

betterquesting.name: Last Chance At Redemption
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the drainpipe and crawl out.** The only way out now is to crawl through a narrow, scum-encrusted drain pipe that leads to an underground waste pond. As bad as all that sounds the will to live is strong, and the settlers will be right behind you.

betterquesting.name: Lurking Horror
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the sewers and clear them of any threats. The access code is 5546.** Whatever this creature is, it's claimed the lives of several hardened deputies. It's likely related to the entities that appear at night, but how it's able to persist is another question. Regardless, it must be destroyed if these settlers have any hope of escaping.

betterquesting.name: The Sleeper Awakens
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with Gyx.** Having triumphed over the Temple Of Trials and taken the heart of his champion, you feel that Gyx will have no choice to show you the respect you deserve. Time to see what he has to say and find out if there's a piece of cheese at the end of this maze.

betterquesting.name: Gain Bonus Labor Points
betterquesting.desc: A score of five gives you two extra labor tokens every time you earn ten. This is done automatically once you have at least ten labor points.

betterquesting.name: Mortal Kombat
betterquesting.desc: **Kill Sakamoto and take page one.** -The thought of killing this man to achieve your objectives doesn't bother you in the slightest, but he seems eager to make a fool of himself, and that's an offer you have a hard time passing up.

tasks.description: Force Sakamoto to hand over the page.

betterquesting.name: Gain Bonus Labor Points
betterquesting.desc: A score of seven gives you three extra labor tokens every time you earn ten. This is done automatically once you have at least ten labor points.

betterquesting.name: Gain Bonus Labor Points
betterquesting.desc: A score of nine gives you four extra labor tokens every time you earn ten. This is done automatically once you have at least ten labor points.

betterquesting.name: Hell House
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some food and water.** -The house is unusually opulent for it's surroundings, and it stands out now, especially, that the land around it has become twisted. Whatever happened to the residents occurred abruptly, because there's no sign of a struggle.

betterquesting.name: We're All Mad Here
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some drugs.** -The sight before you is a strange one, indeed. As if the eclectic design of the house wasn't unusual enough, the dining table seems to have been prepared for company that never arrived. The unusual thing is the fare: mugs and plates covered with a rainbow assortment of uppers, downers, screamers, laughers and in-betweeners. You can scarcely believe your eyes as you shovel handfuls of pills into your pockets.

betterquesting.name: Doomslayer Crypt
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some explosives and a Mining Drill Mk.II.** -As you approach the elaborate tomb you notice piles of tools and explosives crates strewn around the area. The obvious attempt at a forceful entry stands in contrast to the fact that the door seems to have been opened, and not destroyed.

betterquesting.name: Hillmen
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some ammo.** -The house was well concealed inside of a rock outcropping, and it was only by chance that you happened upon it. There's no sign of it's owner, and judging from the thick layer of dust across every surface you conclude that it's been abandoned for some time.

betterquesting.name: Going Down?
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some torches.** -The occupant of the house seems to have left the majority of their belongings behind. Judging from the hatch and the pile of torches you wager there's a dead miner or explorer somewhere down there.

betterquesting.name: Well
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some batteries.** -The presence of a well in the middle of a desert is always a welcome sight, but this one appears to be dry. Where a rope ought to extend into a pool of fresh, cool water, instead you find yourself peering into the depths of a vast cave.

betterquesting.name: It's A Living
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered mushroom vodka.** -A portion of cavern has been converted into a mushroom farm, with the fungus being grown on logs. Despite the inattention of it's owner, it seems to be flourishing. A crate in the corner seems to be filled with bottles, but what could it be?

betterquesting.name: Shrooms!
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some credits.** -It seems the mushroom farmer was interested in more than just agriculture, and had branched out to manufacturing illicit substances. Whatever happened to the owner, they must have been in a hurry, because they left a nice sum of money behind.

betterquesting.name: Rude Awakening
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some ammo.** -The holo-screen suddenly flickers to life as you draw near, triggered by some kind of proximity switch. A video begins to play, and a man comes into focus. He begins to describe a series of events that began with his discovery of a patch of a strange, red rock one morning. He goes on to document, over time, the spread of the unnatural red rock, and the subsequent manifestations of other, more grotesque features. The man becomes increasingly agitated as the video goes on, and vocalizes a concern for his family throughout the recordings. Near the end the logs become more sporadic, and the man's sanity clearly begins to deteriorate. During the final log he appears to be covered in blood, and has completely broken with reality. He screams for several minutes about the loss of his sons to "unseen forces", and curses the Emperor for not saving his wife from the entities. He swears he will prevail against the creatures, and states his intention to retreat to the basement with his father and two young children to weather the storm.

betterquesting.name: Bitter End
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a bolt pistol.** -The ceilings and walls of the room are streaked with crimson stains, and here and there lie the tell-tale piles of bone and preserved tissue. The room was the final resting place for a number of individuals, but there is only one skull. It seems the executioner had no one to take mercy upon him, and the gnawed pile of bones indicates that he met his end at the hungry maws of the entities.

betterquesting.name: Free At Last
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a Plasma Pistol.** -Wading through a pile of bones up to your ankles you find yourself looking at something you never imagined. A scene of ghoulish slaughter, seemingly perpetrated by something that should have been dead. Whatever it was that was put to rest here, or perhaps imprisoned, it seems these explorers woke it up and set it loose upon the world. You shudder at the thought of crossing paths with it as you reach down to pry a Plasma Pistol from a bony hand.

betterquesting.name: Burning The Motors Down
betterquesting.desc: **Craft machine upgrades.** "Upgrade modules can be inserted into a machines inventory to improve it's performance or change how it works. Sometimes it's far better to toss a few Overclockers in one Macerator than it is to build five more of them, and so on for the rest of the machines. The Transformer and Battery Upgrades are almost solely to make it so a machine crammed with Overclockers is able to get the power it needs to operate. Don't forget that Overclocking has diminishing returns: energy usage increases geometrically. Finally, those other Upgrades are for automatically ejecting or retrieving objects. Make sure you put a chest or tank nearby in either case or it won't have anything to eject to or retrieve from."

betterquesting.name: Great Balls Of Fire
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered two Slug Pistols.** -It seems that an explorer tragically stumbled upon a booby trapped building before falling victim to it. A charred skull and a pair of pistols are now all that remain of the aspiring tomb raider.

betterquesting.name: Get Ready
betterquesting.desc: **Click the checkbox to your load your personal data into the cogitator.**

betterquesting.name: Learn About Skills
betterquesting.desc: **Read about how skills and abilities work.** -Skills represent your characters training and experience in specific subjects. There are 14 different skill paths, and each path unlocks up to ten abilities. To gain access to the abilities on a skill path you must invest skill points into that skill. Skill points are invested into the skills below, and the abilities they unlock, if any, are listed to their right. Completing this quest will unlock your beginner abilities, your basic abilities and reward you 15 skill points to invest as you see fit.

betterquesting.name: Learn About Perks
betterquesting.desc: **Read about how perks work.** -Perks are unique and powerful abilities that are unlocked by perk points. You earn perk points every other level starting at level ten. Perks themselves are only available at certain levels, and may also have stat or skill requirements. You can view the available perks below this tab.

betterquesting.name: Learn About Action Points
betterquesting.desc: **Read about how action points work.** -Action points are used to activate abilities, which are unlocked by skills and perks. They regenerate every hour, and the maximum amount of action points you receive per hour is determined by your Agility and some perks. Under normal circumstances you are limited to having a maximum of 20 action points at any time. The number of action points you receive is called your "Action Point Max". Every point you put in Agility gives you one more Action Point Max, and you start with one.

betterquesting.name: Learn About Traits
betterquesting.desc: **Read about how traits work.** -Traits are features that help describe your character, and all of them have positive modifiers. They can radically alter your playstyle, or just give you a boost in general. Choose them wisely, because you can't change them later. Completing this quest will unlock two trait points.

betterquesting.name: Learn About Experience
betterquesting.desc: **Read about how gaining experience and leveling works.** -The only way to earn more stat, skill, action and hit points are to level up. You level up as you gain experience, and there's three ways to earn it: completing quests, killing mobs, gathering vanilla experience and mining ores. Questing is the fastest way to earn it, and the further along a questline you go the more each quest rewards. You'll find your quests on the "Forbidden Planet", "Ab Initio", "Chaos Rising", "Noblesse Oblige" and "Explorer" pages. You will be rewarded four things for leveling: skill points, hit points, perk points, and skill point bonuses. Skill point bonuses are used by the Intelligence stat to determine how many extra skill points you'll get per level, based off your skill point max.

betterquesting.name: A Note About Performance
betterquesting.desc: **Read about some ways to improve the games performance.** -Increase your RAM. You can do this in the technic launcher. Click "launcher options" in the upper right corner of the launcher and go to java settings. Change the RAM to a higher number, I set mine to 4 gigs.   -In video options, set graphics to fast.   -In video options, set smooth lighting to off.   -In video options, set mipmap levels to off. This is a big FPS killer.   -In video options, set your render distance to something lower.   -In video options, set your max framerate to unlimited.   -In video options, set particles to minimal.   -There's a folder in your Blood & Iron directory called "use at your own risk". It contains optifine and fastcraft, two mods that can improve performance significantly but may cause issues on some computers. For that reason they are not pre-loaded into this pack.   -Optifine can give you FPS gains of 20-40 FPS depending on settings. Use the same settings I detailed above for max gains.   -Fastcraft can net you 10-20 FPS.

betterquesting.name: Turn Your Head & Cough
betterquesting.desc: -Locate the vaults clinic, meet with Dr. Heim and obtain a medical report. The access code is 323.

betterquesting.desc: A score of 50 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Conscripts
betterquesting.desc: -Get war readiness to 20 to unluck periodic access to conscripts.

betterquesting.desc: A score of 40 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Endurance 1
betterquesting.desc: A score of one gives you access to +5 HP per level.

betterquesting.name: You're SPECIAL
betterquesting.desc: **Read about how stats work.** -In Blood & Iron, the SPECIAL stats (Strength, Perception, Endurance, Charisma, Intelligence, Agility and Luck) determine what your character will be capable of, and each of them have their own unique purpose, described under the respective stat tab. In addition to their unique characteristics your stats also determine what perks you're eligible for. Finally, stats give a boost to your skills, and for each point you invest in them a few skills will be raised by one or two points. Stat points are invested into the stats below, and the abilities they unlock, if any, are listed to their right. Note that the numbers displayed on this screen are not always accurate, and that if you want to view the number of stat points you actually have, you need to bring up your inventory, select the second tab and scroll over.

betterquesting.name: Repair 50
betterquesting.desc: A score of 50 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Repair 60
betterquesting.desc: A score of 60 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Repair 70
betterquesting.desc: A score of 70 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Repair 80
betterquesting.desc: A score of 80 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Repair 90
betterquesting.desc: A score of 90 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: The Regulators
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the rebels and obtain the stolen supplies. The access code is 3325.** -"The Rebels were once residents of the vault - residents who were greedily hoarding vast amounts of resources. We even suspected that some of the supplies had been obtained by ill-gotten means, but we never had enough evidence to prove it. Nonetheless, we continued to permit them to travel freely and even own weaponry. They abused that freedom to make a grab at everything they could, and they didn't just take their own belongings, they looted their workplaces as well. They even looted the damn clinic and took most of our medicine. They then proceeded to assault the entrance barracks, slaughtering the guards in their sleep. Fortunately for us, Captain Shadows heard the commotion and immediately brought in reinforcements. The rebels panicked and blockaded themselves in, and rather than risk a frontal assault Shadows held the troops back until someone could come up with a better plan than "throw bodies at it". Now that you're here I think we have a better plan."

betterquesting.name: The Uplifting Primer
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some of your supplies.** -Happening upon another chunk of ship, you spot a cluster of the familiar green supply crates. Scrambling to open them, your excitement rapidly fades as you spot a pile of pamphlets, suddenly remembering what this crate contained. As you pull the Lasgun from it's case you let out a drawn out sigh. It's better than nothing, but not by much.

betterquesting.name: Capital Flight
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain Mk.I machinery and a Mk.I Computer.** -"This vault was originally designed to be an ammo dump, it was never intended for habitation. Our motley crew has managed to outfit the place with water, HVAC and even comfortable shelter, but now we're facing parts shortages for all of our jerry-rigged systems, parts we have no way of replacing. Our engineers have informed me that they can build the parts, but they already have a backlog a kilometer long. They also told me that while they have enough workers, they're short on machinery. Now, I can send scavengers out into the wasteland and hope a few that return have a fraction of the parts we need to build these machines, or I can ask you to do it and know that it will get done. Which do you think I'll pick?"

betterquesting.name: Wasteland Express
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain parts to repair a scout suit.** -"When electronic communications are insecure what you really need are basic foot couriers. However, traveling across the surface is a dangerous affair, and most convoys come back minus a few men. That adds up over time. So rather than send out convoys, we've discovered that one messenger in a scout suit can simply outmaneuver any dangers. The problem is that our one good suit is burnt out from overuse and in need of parts we simply can't spare. If you could somehow get those parts for us, it would go a long way toward rebuilding our fractured society."

betterquesting.name: Total Information Awareness
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain four guidance relays.** -"One of the big issues we're facing is our complete lack of control over communications. I don't necessarily want to spy on our citizens, Colonel, but under no circumstances do I want them transmitting any information to hostiles. We could set up a system to filter communications but first we'd need hardware that can handle it. Since the facilities that manufactured our comm equipment went up in vapor with the rest of Mortua City, the only place to find such hardware is in the wasteland. See, before the war, a great many towers were built, ostensibly for communications. Rumors aside, those towers were stocked with sophisticated hardware that we can now make better use of. If you would be so kind as to retrieve us some guidance relays from those towers we would be very thankful. They can be found at the top of the towers."

betterquesting.name: Too Big To Fail
betterquesting.desc: **Locate First Credit Bank and obtain its data logs. The access code is 7911.** -"I have to tell you something, Commissar: this vault didn't always have a good Administrator. When people first took shelter here, they found not peace and safety, but a plutocrat and an army of hired thugs. The survivors lived in squalor and starved while the tyrant and his lackeys feasted, growing fat off the labor of the masses. In fact, the old administrators recklessness nearly lead to the destruction of the vault, and the deaths of all within. That all changed when our current Administrator deposed the fool and pulled the vault back from the edge of the abyss, of course, but the tyrants influence still lingers. Patricia Hughes, a close confidant of the old admin, was left in charge of the local bank's records, effectively giving her total control over our entire monetary system. Commissar, this is too much power for one person, and until now Patricia has tenaciously clung to what vestige of leverage she has left: the data itself. We need you to go in and liberate that data. I don't expect Patricia to resort to violence or sabotage in the face of your authority, but her greed is matched only by her arrogance, and she has become drunk on the perks of her position. Be careful."

tasks.description: Speak with Patricia Hughes and request the bank's records.

betterquesting.name: Labor Relations
betterquesting.desc: **Locate Rikter and obtain the signed labor agreement. The access code is 6317.** -"In my mind the good of the Imperium comes before personal gain and petty ambition, but there are many who disagree with that sentiment. We have one such man here in the vault, and we are all in the unfortunate position of being at his mercy. His name is Rikter, and he controls the scavengers guild with an iron grip. Since we are dependent on scavengers for resources, and no scavenger does business without the guilds approval, that grants Rikter undue influence over our very survival. As much as I'd like to resolve the situation on my own, I simply do not have the influence to do so without causing another civil war. The good news is that your arrival has him shaken up; he knows his days are numbered. I decided to take advantage of his moment of weakness by extending an olive branch of sorts and offering him a deal. I now only require the signed agreement from him, and I think it would be a good show of force if you personally retrieved it."

tasks.description: Speak with Rikter and convince him to hand over the agreement.

betterquesting.name: Rules Of Acquisition
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the Ad-Mech mainframe and obtain a universal data disk. The access code is 2295.** -"Colonel, I know you have a history with the Ad-Mech, but I need to ask you to put aside your feelings, because the fate of humanity hinges upon on what happens here. From what I understand of the Ad-Mech's protocol, they will be scrambling to call in a fleet to glass this planet post-haste. The technology we discovered here is too radical, and they'll fear it will make them obsolete. Colonel, we can't let that happen. The Dust alone is far too valuable. We must stop that message from ever going out, but to do so we need to know more about their technology. Go to their vault and locate the mainframe, it will have the data we need. You can either hack it and risk invoking their wrath, or you can use a program Roach is working on to assist you. This can be done without bloodshed, but regardless of your decision, I'd like you to speak with Roach first."

betterquesting.name: The Hammer Falls
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with the leader of the commerce guild. The access code is 3591.** -"Colonel, we have an emergency. We need you to head to the commerce district, immediately. The leader of the commerce guild is attempting a coup, and he's threatening to blow up the vault if his demands aren't met. His name is Nero, and if what he says is true then he figured out a way to drill through the harmonized rockcrete, right to a plasma port. Those things connect directly to the vaults plasma reactor; if it blows then the only thing left of this vault will be a scorched crater. He's only willing to speak with you, but he says he's willing to negotiate. You can find his office on the second floor of the Reuben Building. I'd like to see this situation resolved without any collateral damage, but I understand that Commissars don't typically negotiate with insurgents. I'll prep the body bags."

tasks.description: Speak with Nero and try to defuse the situation.

betterquesting.name: A Clever Disguise
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain a set of red Carapace Armor.** -"This is it. We've had an intelligence breakthrough, and we're ready to make a play for Burke. After a long trek through the desert some of our field agents managed to corner one of Burke's scavenger teams. After several rounds of enhanced interrogation followed by some spying we've learned that Burke's isolated herself and hasn't been seen for some time. This is our opportunity to end this war without any further loss of Imperial life, and we end it by terminating her command. First, we'll need a disguise for one of our agents: a set of red carapace armor. Without it, his plan to get you past the guards cannot proceed. On a separate, brighter, note, I thought I'd update you on the status of the vault. Residents are eating regular meals, morale is up, and every corner of the vault echoes with the sounds of new construction. There is hope again, for the first time since before all hell broke loose, and it's because of you. Thank you, Colonel."

betterquesting.name: Apocalypse When
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with the field agent at the abandoned farm. The access code is 5129. WARNING! COMPLETING THIS QUEST WILL MAKE THE LOST & DAMNED HOSTILE TO YOU. YOU WILL NO LONGER BE ABLE TO DO LOST & DAMNED (CHAOS RISING) QUESTS!** -"The agent and his team are set up and ready to go, Colonel. They're waiting for you at an abandoned farm near Burke's vault. You'll find them in the bomb shelter adjacent to the dried up well. Head there immediately and speak with the agent, he'll brief you on the details of the operation. I understand that you'll have reservations, and I don't blame you, but consider this: you'll be executing a traitor and putting an end to this war in one fell swoop."

tasks.description: Speak with Special Agent Hong Manata.

betterquesting.name: The Road To Perdition
betterquesting.desc: **Locate Burke.** -"According to the reports, Burke's mansion is a sprawling, opulent palace situated in the heart of her vault. You may have some difficulty locating her once you're inside, but if what my agents tell me is correct you'll be facing no resistance, other than Burke herself. Search the place thoroughly, Colonel, it's likely she has some hidden rooms or passages. Oh, one other thing: we've sent along a little care package for you. I think it'll come in handy for your confrontation, and it's as fine a suit of power armor as any Astartes model, believe it or not."

tasks.description: Search Burke's mansion for a clue as to where she could be.

pages:9.8: Commander, the construction is complete and your chapel is prepared. The code is 8326.

betterquesting.name: To Seed A Barren World
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the tech-vault and obtain a Terraformer. The access code is 4651.** -"One element of leadership is giving people hope and hope is wearing pretty thin these days. While your presence has been a boon for morale, it's not enough. We need to give people a brighter future. They came here to settle this world, not huddle in the dark for survival, and even though the chances of that happening are slim there is one thing that could turn the tide in our favor: a Terraformer. Terraformers are capable of reshaping the climate and stratum of localized areas with only power as an input. Colonel, something like that would ensure limitless amounts of food for our vault, and it may make it possible to reshape the wasteland into a paradise. I need you to head to the coordinates I provided. We have reason to believe a tech-vault some workers discovered while prospecting actually contains a working Terraformer. In the interest of full disclosure, I have to tell you this: you're not the first person I've sent to that tech-vault. In fact, not even the third. None of those scouts ever came back. What I'm saying is be careful. We can't afford to lose you."

betterquesting.name: Garbage Day
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with "Ashcan" Pete.** -"I have a very important job for you, but first you'll need some information, and you can get it from the local miscreant: "Aschan" Pete. Pete haunts the refugee camp these days, selling those poor people the only kind of relief that helps them escape their nightmares. While it's true that I permit the sale of chems in most cases, raw Morphium is far too addictive and deadly to allow, even under these circumstances. Find him, get the code, and if he gives you a hard time, use the fact that he's liable to be executed to convince him."

tasks.description: Speak with Ashcan Pete about Jenny's apartment code.

betterquesting.name: Idle Rich
betterquesting.desc: **Locate Jenny Porcine and obtain the security clearance card. The access code is 8675.** -"The Porcine family were some of the first settlers to make it to the safety of the vault and they immediately set up shop on the ideal level for a greenhouse. Since then they have routinely capitalized on that bit of foresight, much to the dismay of every starving refugee stumbling in from the wastes. I'll admit, Amelia Porcine was a genius when it came to botany, and her husband Horace was one hell of an engineer. That greenhouse ran like clockwork; it was completely automated, and it regularly churned out bushels of fresh produce. That is until several months ago when Amelia suddenly died of a stroke. Horace's health went downhill shortly afterward, and he was dead of a stroke before Amelia had even been cremated. We immediately suspected foul play, with the only possible suspect being Jenny, their only child, caregiver, and an alleged Morphium addict. We never got enough to bring her in on and we lacked all the advanced medical equipment we'd need to run a proper autopsy. Colonel, as much as I lament their passing and likely murder, here's where it gets worse: Jenny is now in control of that greenhouse and she's running it into the ground. Output is down over 70 percent since she's taken over and food prices have skyrocketed as a result. That greenhouse is too important to this vault to let it fall into ruin in the careless hands of an addict, so the Administrator and I have decided that it must be nationalized at any cost. The only way to do this seamlessly is to obtain the security keycard from Jenny or her premises. She currently resides in the penthouse of the Jason Shniggle Memorial Apartments. She's quite the recluse, Colonel, and I'm afraid she's liable to sabotage the greenhouse remotely if we go in with force. I need you to get in there and get that card without alerting her, and ideally before any more of our people go hungry."

betterquesting.name: Man-Eating God-Creator
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain equipment.** -"Unless you don't mind pissing those Adeptus Mechanicus freaks off, you'll need to work with our resident computer genius, Roach. He says he can design a worm that can get you into their network, but that it will take years unless our systems receive a serious upgrade. Get him these supplies and I'll personally make it worth your while. Oh, and please grab some of that black stained glass, too. It's just a cheap surface to project holograms onto, but it's hard to salvage."

betterquesting.name: SNAFU
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with Francisco.** -"Colonel, I need to speak with you in person."

tasks.description: Speak with Francisco about your encounter with Burke.

betterquesting.name: Heart Of Darkness
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with Burke about the stash of viral weaponry before terminating her command. The access code is 8326.** -"Colonel, before you take Burke down we need some answers from her. Reports have indicated that the Dark Mechanicus have been hard at work developing potent viral weaponry. What's most unsettling is the parallels that are being drawn between what they're manufacturing and the Virus Bombs of old. Horrible weapons; the life eater virus was voracious and potent enough to reduce all the biological matter on a planet into slurry and flammable gas. Then all that was needed was a spark. We have enough problems here as it is, so make sure you ascertain whether there is any truth to this before you eliminate her."

tasks.description: Speak with Burke and find out more about the virus bombs.

betterquesting.name: Tithing
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain credits.** -"The Emperor demands sacrifice, brothers and sisters! Lay before him your blood, your arms, and your worldly possessions and He will lift your spirit and bless your toils with success!"

betterquesting.name: New Quests Available: Noblesse Oblige
betterquesting.desc: this is triggered after you speak with the priest in level two of the imperial vault.

betterquesting.name: Pennance
betterquesting.desc: **Kill Daemons.** -"Make no mistake, the foul beasts that now call the surface home are the creatures known as Daemons. Yet even with our faith tested so, now is the time when the righteous and sinful alike must come together in defense of humanity! Take up arms, take up arms and go forth to fight! Go forth to drive them back!"

betterquesting.name: Salvation
betterquesting.desc: **Kill Daemons.** -"Those wretched things that slither and crawl across our world are destined for only one fate: to be cast back into the warp! Drive them! Drive them with fist, steel, bullet, fire, bolt, but drive them! Go! Go and purge them all! There is no hope for those who do not take up arms!"

betterquesting.name: Grim Offerings
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain materials.** -"Look about at the works of man on Mortua and you will find little to draw inspiration from. Nary a stone of greater value is to be seen but for the facade of commerce. Scarce reminders of our ancestors are perched or placed here or there, to remind us of where we came from, but not here. Rectify this and you will be rewarded, for the Emperor himself smiles on those who glorify His worship through beautification of humanities holdings."

betterquesting.name: Iconography
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain ancient relics.** -"The people of Mortua were of peculiar faith; they were of a different era entirely, a dour time when man grew too reliant on machine, and machine rebelled. A Dark Age of Technology. Do not begrudge them for their ignorance though, for while they were weak of spirit they were skilled in craft, and they produced many fine things. Collect some of these objects so that the church may learn more of these ancients and determine if their practices were heretical. They can be found in tombs and crypts all across the surface of this blighted world."

betterquesting.name: Beasts Of No Nation
betterquesting.desc: **Kill passive beasts.** -"Mortua is only a death world on the outside, my children. Within, it's a paradise awaiting the sculptors hand. Mortua itself longs to become a great, and so it entices us with a bounty: ores, minerals, Dust, and an ecosystem. Yes, I know, the barren red wastes stretch on for leagues, but there are lulls in the sand where life blooms. In some of these strange oasis you may even come upon native life, some hostile and some passive. Seek out those creatures that might prove useful to man's efforts here on Mortua and learn of them. The Yale can be found in mountainous areas. The Aspid can be found in swamps and sinkholes. The Maka can be found across many different biomes, but occurs in plains and jungles more often."

betterquesting.name: Reliquary
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain ancient relics.** -"Any church worth its salt ought to have a library, as well as a collection of relics, both holy and profane. Though we preach single-minded faith, total ignorance can not bring forth enlightenment, and we thus toil in His name to illuminate the deeds of the righteous and condemn those of the heretic.
