Go forth into the wasteland and delve the tombs and crypts that dot the surface. There you will find the relics we seek."

betterquesting.name: Infernal Command
betterquesting.desc: **Kill Behemoths.** -"It is clear to me now that there is an order to the madness of the Daemons. There are leaders among them: the towering, hoofed Behemoths. I am plagued by visions of them marshaling legions of the damned to wage an eternal war against the faithful. I fear that if they grow too bold, that their hold on the surface grow so absolute, they may make a push for the vault. We cannot allow that to happen. Go forth and kill 14 of those monsters, in the name of the Emperor and the Imperium!"

betterquesting.name: Iconoclast
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain ancient relics.** -"It has come to my attention through study and meditation that there exists a number of wicked idols crafted by nameless things scattered across Mortua. I fear dark rites and malign artistry may have been employed to create objects of great evil, fetishes which can turn men to madness and inhuman cruelty. Now that your faith has been tempered, it is time to go forth for a final test. Bring me these relics, for they must be destroyed before their corruption can seep out and infect those that remain. Take heed, and do not let your gaze linger on them."

betterquesting.name: A Higher Patron
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically receive food and water.** -"The Emperor was no mere mortal man, but through his infinite wisdom he knows your pain, and he does not turn away. Look about you now! Is your hunger not satiated, is your thirst not quenched? You see, He provides for us, the faithful, with a bounty of luck, so that not  one among us need go hungry or thirsty! All that he requires is faith, and a simple pledge: your life in the defense of mankind."

betterquesting.name: Fiery Blessing
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange steel and Dust for Inferno Bolt Mags.** -"The most sacred of weapons counted among the arsenal of mankind is without a doubt the bolter. It is by bolt and chainsword the Astartes have brought Imperial justice to the farthest reaches of the galaxy, cutting down the xenos and the heretic with equal fury. Your service to the Emperor and your faith have held strong, and He does bless the faithful. You may now find yourself able to shape the simplest elements into the avatar of his fiery judgement."

betterquesting.name: Good Shepard
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically summon beasts.** -"Once you have come to know the ways of the beasts you will see as they do and understand their wants and temperament. Controlling them will become trivial, given you can provide them safe pasture. Call out and you will see that the Emperor's hand pushes them to you."

betterquesting.name: Charged Belief
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange glass, steel and Dust for an EC pack.** -"Listen: the Emperor knows your struggle, as he knows the struggle of all his servants. So it is your faith in Him that will give you the strength of will to shape glass, steel and Dust into a form that can be used to bring swift death to his enemies."

betterquesting.name: Hammer Of God
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange steel plates and Dust for Adamantium plates.** -"Now that you have witnessed the host of miracles ranging from the mundane to the divine it's time to unveil before you one final gift. Behold! Mere steel is brought together with Dust, and through your hand the Emperor acts, rewarding us with the divine metal: Adamantium!"

betterquesting.name: The Private Sector
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with Durkan.** -"Durkan Engineering is the home of the best, and last, engineering firm on the planet. Durkan runs a tight ship and has cooperated with me fully since day one. He is also, as the vaults chief engineer, in charge of the foundry, but the foreman there usually took care of the laborers. Until lately, that is. Just talk to Durkan, I have granted him authority to deal with this issue as he sees fit."

tasks.description: Speak with Durkan about Francisco's problem.

betterquesting.name: Clawed Back
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain greenhouse parts. The access code is 1374.** -"At the risk of opening up some old wounds I'm going to remind you of the affair regarding the Porcines. Jenny, may the Emperor bless her soul, was certainly a troubled child, and while we all regret what happened to her we move on by acknowledging that we do what is necessary for the good of the people. Now, that's that, and the time has come to discuss the matter of the Porcine estate. It requires more than spring cleaning to be brought back to its former glory, but we're confident that it can be done. Help us procure these parts and seeds and it will be operational within the month."

betterquesting.name: Mechanized Warfare
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain raw materials.** -"The re-activated foundry, Durkan Engineering and the technology we've found here on Mortua should allow us to build up a formidable industrial base. However, there's yet another snag in our plans: we're short on raw materials. We exhausted what little we had rebuilding our guard force, strengthening our defenses, and consolidating the vault in the wake of your conquests, and we simply cannot afford the caravans prices. We need your help again, Colonel, and this time we come as beggars. Please, spare us what materials you can, and use your considerable survival skills to acquire the rest."

betterquesting.name: Unsafe Work Environment
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with foreman Richards. The access code is 5923.** -"I've known Richards for years, and he's a stern, no-nonsense kind of guy. He takes no excuses, and leads by example. If he's the ringleader, it's only because the situation is beyond bad, maybe damn near intolerable. He'll be reasonable, Colonel, but don't think he'll go down without a fight. I usually wouldn't trust a business man like Mikhail to negotiate a labor dispute, but I know him, and his relationship with those workers will be an asset, not a liability. I hope between the two of you a peaceful solution to this crisis can be found. I would normally find myself among these men, and I do sympathize with them, but under these circumstances we simply cannot afford what they're asking of us, and time is of the essence. May the Emperor guide us, Colonel."

tasks.description: Speak with foreman Richards about lifting the strike.

betterquesting.name: Hot Cargo
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the pitchblende mine and obtain 124 pitchblende ore.** -"One element our war machine is sorely lacking is uranium. The nuclear batteries that fuel power armor require enormous amounts of the stuff and our own reserves are nearly exhausted. Scouts report a large deposit of pitchblende under the abandoned town of Ironsmith and we would all be very grateful if you looked into it. Get the ore if you can, but exercise extreme caution; the things we've heard about the town are quite distressing."

betterquesting.name: Turn Your Head & Cough
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the clinic and speak with Dr. Heim.** -"You know Colonel, it occurs to me that during your stay on Mortua you've crashed at least one spaceship, been clawed, stabbed, shot, lazed, scorched and Emperor knows what else, and still you've not had a proper medical checkup. You need to see our Doctor, Colonel, in fact I refuse to ask anything else of you until you do. You've become more than a soldier, you're a strategic asset and as such your health is of paramount importance."

betterquesting.name: Total Recall
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with Arbitrator Dolan and find out what's going on.** -As your mind succumbs to the sedative you feel sleep tugging at your eyelids. A gentle warmth glides over you in waves, gradually nudging you further into a deep slumber. You are enveloped in an encompassing darkness now, and just as your tenuous grasp on consciousness begins slipping away you see a beacon of light in your minds eye. It's hard to make out, but it's getting closer and gradually comes into focus; it's a manor. A sprawling estate situated in the midst of vast pine barrens. The scene is upon you now, and you notice people milling about all over the place; ex-colleagues of yours, you realize. This is a memory of a case you solved ages ago, before you'd become a Commissar, before you'd even joined the Guard, back when you were just another inspector in the Arbites of planet Caladan. You now find yourself standing inside the mansion, just as if you were actually there. Struggling to remember the details of the case, you see your old friend Arbitrator Dolan and resolve to get the answers out of him.

tasks.description: Speak with Dolan and find out what's going on.

pages:9.8: [scribbled on the side is the code 4238]

betterquesting.name: Case Closed
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and examine the body. The access code is 4238.** -Speaking with Dolan barely jarred your memory, and though you have a vague recollection of the events unfolding before your eyes it's a feeling more akin to deja vu than a real memory. The dossier on the suspect revealed some disturbing details about the mind of the killer, and you doubt that you would have simply forgotten about a case of this magnitude. The same gnawing, sinking feeling of dread that you experienced on Mortua is now leaving you racked with psychic torment. Terrible things claw at the edges of your tattered psyche, pulling at the unraveling threads and threatening to unwind you. You fear what lurks in this place, but deep down you know that the only way out of this nightmare is through it. Perhaps inspecting the suspects body will give you some idea of whether this is a hallucination or a memory, and whether your aching suspicion that the true culprit remains at large is valid.

betterquesting.name: Electron Highways
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain 124 copper ingots.** -"We need copper for everything, and with all the work going on we need it more than ever. It's becoming a big bottleneck and the vault can't afford to wait on scavengers. 124 ingots will be enough to get us back on track, and then some. Like iron, copper is another resource that appears in large concentrations. You can spot an area rich in copper by the chalcopyrite intrusions on the surface. It's a yellowish metal, so it stands out."

betterquesting.name: Magnetic Personality
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain 64 iron ingots.** -"You're very resourceful, Colonel. I can understand why he admires you so much. If you're going to be sticking around then may I ask that you gather some iron for me? Say, 64 ingots? Excessive? No, no, I assure you, it's a drop in the bucket. I can tell you where to find all the iron you could want, if you're the adventurous sort. Well, not so much where to find it as how to find it. See, there are very rich deposits of iron scattered across Mortua, and limonite fields are a tell-tale sign of titanic quantities of iron ore lurking just under the surface. Rare, relatively speaking, but if you can find one you'll have no problem getting a measly 64 ingots."

betterquesting.name: System Overhaul
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain 64 Dust.** -"From what I've heard your somewhat of an expert on the Dust. If that's true, then you're the perfect person to get me a bundle of it for some practical research. I've only begun to scratch the surface of its abilities, but I have a theory that it can be used to fill in the blanks, so to speak, in many mechanical applications. If my theory proves correct then I can finally install some advanced machines in the workshop downstairs, despite our shortage of critical parts."

betterquesting.name: New Quests Available: Noblesse Oblige
betterquesting.desc: this is triggered after you speak wtih Durkan about investors

betterquesting.name: Sands Of Time
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain 32 huge quartz crystals.** -"There are primordial regions of Mortua where volcanism has sundered, bringing treasure with it. I've seen it myself: huge crystal spires of solid quartz. Those crystals, as it turns out, are the perfect templates for the Dust to imprint itself upon. The Dust moves through it like a swarm of tiny insects, etching out patterns that can be used for anything from computing to power storage. I've also seen some crystals growing out in the open desert, but all the ones nearby have been harvested by the scavengers. For now, look for the volcanic regions, you can't miss them."

betterquesting.name: Steel Reserve
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain 256 steel ingots.** -"We've reached a critical juncture in the workshops development and we need more machines, period. More machines means new parts, and that means more steel. I hate to keep coming back to you for this, but you are very good at it, such as it is. My suggestion is simply to break down old dwellings in the wasteland and melt down the parts. It's a dirty job but someone's got to do it."

betterquesting.name: Heavy Metal
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain 64 lead and nickel ingots.** -"Working with radioactives is dangerous business, and sometimes the cleansuits the workers wear just aren't enough. We've had more and more people coming down with rad sickness, and it's not acceptable. On top of that, many of our precision tools are wearing out from overuse. As much as I'd like to just replace them with steel parts, we need something harder. The only solution is to start doping our steel with nickel. It can be done by my workers, but we have almost no nickel. What I'm saying is, please get us lead and nickel so I can keep my people safe and replace our tools."

betterquesting.name: Silver Linings
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain 64 silver ingots.** -"Silver is more than just a shiny, valuable metal. It has many applications in industry, among other fields. We need more of it, much more, if we are to realize the workshops true potential."

betterquesting.name: Gold Fever
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain 64 gold ingots.** -"So, you can sell your gold to those damned commodity traders, or you can give it to me. I know, I'm really sweetening the deal, but I promise that if everything comes together as planned, I'll be making both of us very wealthy."

betterquesting.name: The Jewel Of Mortua
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain 64 diamonds and emeralds.** -"This is it, the final phase of my plan. We need pure, natural diamonds and emeralds, industrial diamonds will not suffice. These have to be the real thing. The best place to find them is the same place I told you to look for the quartz crystals at: the volcanic regions. The regions in the deep desert are known to have large spikes of gem-bearing rock poking out from the surface like needles. Go there and we can finally complete this project."

betterquesting.name: Paying Dividends
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically receive credits from Durkan engineering.** -"It worked! I don't know how, but it worked! We can synthesize matter from energy! It's astounding! I don't understand any of the science behind it, but with the help of the Dust we were able to make it work. Now we can use any excess energy from the vaults plasma reactor to make whatever parts we need. This changes everything. In the vault it'll make Durkan Engineering rich, but out in the wider universe? By the Emperor, think of the possibilities. Even with the modest profits the firm reaps, we will have more than enough credits to pay you regular dividends on your investments. Thank you, Colonel. You've helped bring the impossible to life."

betterquesting.name: It Shall Set You Free
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the master bedroom and examine it. The access code is 336.** -The oversights of the investigators on this scene cannot be accidental. To miss such glaring details is either gross incompetence or deliberate negligence, and either is equally confounding. Though the how and why is beyond your grasp, you get the impression that someone high up doesn't want the truth to come out, and that your findings will somehow be lost in the shuffle. Fighting through the mounting tension, you struggle to compose yourself. Falling back into that worn groove of your time in the Arbites, you steel yourself and determine to follow through with the investigation the best way you know how: using your intuition. Your superiors are clearly content to lay the blame on a dead man and close the case, for whatever reason, but you deduce that more substantial evidence could make a compelling point for leaving it open.

betterquesting.name: War Is Hell
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with General Ragnar.** -"In ancient times, during the Dark Age of Technology, the Mortuans were a civilization of scientists and craftsmen. They held mastery over many exotic technologies, and wielded them as tools to put an end to all want and need. In their decadence they gradually turned to Chaos. Their society, collapsing into anarchy, and their planet on the brink of becoming a daemon world, they again turned to technology. Laboring in desperation they constructed a machine that could free Mortua from the warps influence. Deep in the heart of their last stronghold, the machine roared to life, and immediately its effects were felt. A bubble of energy that completely nullified the warp shone like a brilliant white flash around the planet, and suddenly Mortua was free of the malevolent influence of the immaterium. The peace was brief. When the field collapsed the planet and the entire region of space around it was wracked by a violent warp storm. The Mortuans were scoured from the planet as it cracked and shook, its seas boiling away and terrible, hellish landscapes materialising across the surface. It stayed that way many for millenia, until the machines reactor finally broke down, releasing the planet and the surrounding space from the warps grasp. Knowing this, Burke seeks to plunge the planet back into the warp, only this time she'll bring a much larger area with it. Those towers she had constructed act as amplifiers for the machine, and with so many it's a safe bet that thousands of inhabited worlds will meet terrible ends should she re-activate the machine. For the sake of trillions of souls, I must stop her."

betterquesting.name: New Quests Available: Noblesse Oblige
betterquesting.desc: this is triggered after talking with Ragnar after fighting Burke the first time

betterquesting.name: Agriculture
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain agricultural products.** -"The war machine won't run on an empty stomach, Commissar. We barely have enough to feed our own citizens and the refugees as it is, and as much as I'd like to let those lazy bastards starve we can't run the risk of food riots. Fighting men and women need more food than your average slothful civvie, and they need cellulux too, and plenty of it. No, we don't feed them cellulux, we make them armor from it. Round us up some military rations and throw in a big load of cellulux with it anytime you can and pretty soon we'll get this war started!"

betterquesting.name: Finished Goods
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain finished goods.** -"If you can somehow manage to build up more industrial capacity than us, more power to you! If that's the case, just give us finished goods. It'll save us the time of making them ourselves."

betterquesting.name: Conscripts
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 20: periodically access free conscripts.** -"Commissar, I'm sure you're familiar with the process of conscription. It's not ideal, but by the Emperor, we need warm bodies on the battlefield, experience be damned! If those lazy refugees won't volunteer to serve in this mans guard, then we won't give them a choice! Slap some flak on 'em, put a lasgun in their hands, and send 'em into the thick of it! Sure, they won't last too long, but you know how it goes: smoke 'em while you got 'em."

betterquesting.name: Astra Militarum
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 30: periodically access Guardsmen.** -"Guardsmen are more than just a bodies in some armor, more than just some dumb grunts you point in the enemies direction and shout at, but they're not much more. These soldiers aren't free like their Shanghaied subordinates, but you're paying for a better product. More durable, accurate, disciplined and battle-hardened, but don't let that fool you: they're still a bunch of rookies."

10.Line:8: [the guardsman slumps lifelessly to the ground]

betterquesting.name: Deadeye
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 40: periodically access Snipers.** -"The finest shooters the vault's got. They'll put a slug of metal in a target farther away than you can see. Their rifles don't have a lot of stopping power, though, so make sure they have plenty of room to whittle down tougher enemies."

10.Line:8: [the sniper slumps lifelessly to the ground]

betterquesting.name: Heavy Weapons Guy
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 50: periodically access Heavies.** -"We get together the biggest, burliest bastards we've got, tape some extra steel plates around 'em, and send 'em packing with a heavy machine gun. They're slow as hell, bot boy howdy can they lay down some fire."

10.Line:8: [the heavy slumps lifelessly to the ground]

betterquesting.name: Rocket Man
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 60: periodically access Demolitions.** -"Sometimes you just need to blow something up, and these troops are perfect for the job! They'll lob those big HE rockets across the battlefield and even if they don't score a direct hit, they'll do some damage."

10.Line:8: [the demo man slumps lifelessly to the ground]

Entity:10.MercenaryDialogHired:8: Need me to blow something up?

betterquesting.name: Tempestus Scions
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 70: periodically access Storm Troopers.** -"Tempestus Scions, the most elite pureblood human fighting force the galaxies ever known. These sons of bitches are as hard as adamantium. They move faster, fight harder, take more hits, and turn the Emperor's enemies into slag heaps with those Hellguns. Be a damn shame to see 'em go to waste, so we even gave them advanced field medic training. Take care of them, Commissar, each one represents a significant investment of our time and resources."

10.Line:8: By the Emperor, it's a shooting gallery.
[the storm trooper slumps lifelessly to the ground]
You call down the thunder and I'll reap the whirlwinds.

Entity:10.MercenaryDialogFarewell:8: [the storm trooper motions that he's standing guard]

betterquesting.name: The Word Of God
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 80: periodically access Priests.** -"Priests are some of the craziest bastards I've ever had the luck to see in action. They stroll right into the thick of it, staring down their adversaries as they chant and shout. I don't know what protects them, but it sure as hell isn't those robes they wear. They fight like maniacs with those chainswords, and their words inspire men to fight beyond their breaking point. They come in two flavors around here: combat and support. The combat priests are tough as hell, and the support priests focus on healing, keeping all the nearby friendlies in fighting shape."

10.Line:8: I will send you back to hell!
[the combat priest slumps lifelessly to the ground]

Entity:10.MercenaryDialogFarewell:8: I'll keep the darkness at bay.

10.Line:8: None shall withstand the Emperors might!
[the support priest slumps lifelessly to the ground]

Entity:10.MercenaryDialogFarewell:8: I'll keep the darkness at bay.

betterquesting.name: The Emperor's Finest
betterquesting.desc: **Readiness of 90: periodically access Elite Guardsmen.** -"An elite guardsman is what you get when you combine a veteran storm trooper with power armor, a bolter and a power sword. What they lack in speed and grace they make up for in sheer fighting power."

10.Line:8: None can stand in our path!
[the elite guardsman slumps lifelessly to the ground]

betterquesting.name: Raw Materials
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain raw materials.** -"If we're going to win this war then we'll need to out-produce the enemy. We need guns, ammo, armor and plenty of them. Get us the raw materials we need to keep the factories running and you'll be on your way to leading your own army in no time!"

betterquesting.name: The Final Countdown
betterquesting.desc: **Get war readiness to 100.** -"Varakesh. The ancient city will be the object of the final war for Mortua, and whoever wins will control the future of the planet and it's people. In the heart of the necropolis lies the salvation of both sides. For Burke, the ability to achieve apotheosis, becoming a godlike daemon princess. For Francisco, the means to ending the warp storms and banishing the daemons back to the immaterium. The only certainty is that force of arms will carry the day, and to those ends I must ensure that our people are fully prepared."

betterquesting.name: Angel Investor
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange iron and Dust for credits.** -"In light of your considerable donations it's only natural that I extend our typical profit share plan to you. From now on any excess Dust and iron you have can make you some money, so keep us in mind."

betterquesting.name: Power Tycoon
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange copper and quartz for credits.** -"Your ongoing involvement with Durkan Engineering truly means a lot to us. I treat my employees like family, and they reward me with results. Our firm is proud of its contributions to the vault and the Imperium, and I believe that the foundation of our achievements comes from our culture. Going forward, I want you to know that we're willing to buy copper and quartz off you at a premium; it's the same deal we extend to all members of our family."

betterquesting.name: Steel City
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange steel and lead for credits.** -"Now that we've repaired our tools and reinforced the workshop with lead plating in key areas we've returned to optimal efficiency levels. This is good news, but we will continue to need materials to stay at this level, given all the maintenance considerations. Regular shipments of lead, and especially steel, are worthy of a reward, so I hope you have some to spare."

betterquesting.name: Rare Meddle
betterquesting.desc: **Periodically exchange gold, silver, diamonds and emeralds for credits.** -"I'll buy the precious metals off you at a premium, and since no one will buy the diamonds around here other than me, I guess it's a captive market. Don't worry, I'm far too afraid of you to try to take advantage. We're so close now, you and I, and soon we'll make Mortua into the shining city on the hill."

betterquesting.name: War Never Changes
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and speak with General Ragnar.** -"Ragnar's a beast of a man who rose to prominence in the guerrilla war against Burke. He was a hell of a fighter before that, a Catachan, but retired here with his family as a reward for his outstanding service. I don't think he ever considered the possibility of becoming a general, but he certainly fits the bill. Talk to him about assembling our military, he can tell you everything you need to know."

tasks.description: Speak with General Ragnar about building an Imperial army.

betterquesting.name: Final Destination
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered your Chainsword.** -The Schola Progenium trains it pupils in the use of a wide variety of weapons, both ranged and melee. The Chainsword is one of the more ubiquitous of those, and mastering it's use is essential to it's wielder's health. You've managed to hold on to your current sword for some time now, having used it to brutally murder hundreds across a score of worlds. You're happy to have found it, and you rev it a few times for your own satisfaction.

betterquesting.name: Who Watches The Watchmen
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a Sniper Rifle.** -The tower was eerily quiet. It clearly hadn't been used in a long time. The lights still worked, though, and the door was solid. The only question you have is why someone would leave so many supplies behind.

betterquesting.name: Tower Of Babel
betterquesting.desc: **You found a piece of scout armor.** -The tower looks like it was bombarded by heavy artillery, so the chance of finding anything is slim. Still, it shows signs of having recently been occupied.

betterquesting.name: Knowledge Is Power
betterquesting.desc: **Successfully answer Sakamoto's questions and prove you're with the Lost & Damned to obtain page one.** -Your curiousity getting the best of you, and the alternative of simply killing the man being available regardless, you don't see anything wrong with engaging in some high-stakes trivia.

betterquesting.name: One Toke Over The Line
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some of your supplies.** -You honestly can't believe you were able to fly so well when you were that high. Now the only thing that scares you more than being deserted on a ruined death world is the prospect of running dry. Thank the Emperor you found what's left of your stash.

betterquesting.name: Shawn's Got The Shotgun
betterquesting.desc: **You discover a Shotgun.** -The closet is dim, but an errant ray of light hits something buried in a pile of debris, reflecting a familiar cobalt-blue gleam. Pushing aside the refuse, a shotgun and several mags of shells are uncovered. This ought to get those primitive screwheads attention!

betterquesting.name: A Ribbon Of Black
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a Batt-Pack Mk.II.** -The enormous tower looms over the landscape, it's presence filling you with unease. You feel quite lucky to have noticed the Batt-Pack Mk.II wedged carelessly between a server rack, a computer and a filing cabinet.

betterquesting.name: Secrets And Lies
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the basement and find out what lurks under the Zaven mansion. The code is 849.** -You knew from your brief that the basement was a modest wine cellar, but something else was there, too. Something dark.

betterquesting.name: Calm Before The Storm
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with Francisco and let him know you met with the doctor.** -With a new found clarity of thought and a fresh sense of purpose, you find yourself ready to step-up to the task of leading the Imperium to victory on Mortua. It's time to speak with Francisco; you're ready for the final act.

betterquesting.name: Mortua Man
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a piece of scout armor.** -Nestled within a crate fortuitously preserved within a hunk of ship you notice a piece of scout armor. A pool of tar sand must have absorbed the brunt of the wrecks impact, else you'd be left with nothing but scrap metal.

betterquesting.name: Live Like A Refugee
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered water.** -This camp was definitely being used to house people against their will. Whether it was reserved for criminals or civilians cannot be discerned from what scant clues have been left behind. Whatever happened here occurred quickly, for while the residents are no where to be found essential supplies were left behind. You fear for the worst.

betterquesting.name: Dead Line
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered ammo in the comm station.** -The communications station is a mess of paperwork, smashed up office furniture and picked over electronics, with nobody in sight. There might be something lying around that could give you an idea of what happened here.

betterquesting.name: Dead Man's Chest
betterquesting.desc: **You found a piece of scout armor.** -In the corner of the wrecked communication facility you notice an odd lump covered in tattered clothing. As you move closer numerous large insects scuttle away, pulling the cloth with them and disturbing the dessicated bones underneath. Upon closer inspection you realize that it's an officers uniform and just barely make out the name "LAHEY" on a patch. As you search the remains for clues you notice a chest underneath concealed by grime and sand. This officer was clearly willing to die to defend the contents, but why?

pages:9.8:
0900: reports of hvy combat across planet. numerous casualties. arbites burned alive in precinct.
0927: civs attacking comm site. comm arrays offline any moment. send relief.

betterquesting.name: Shop Smart
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered agricultural supplies.** -The supply depot's clearly seen better days, and signs of conflict are everywhere. It looks like it was used to store farming equipment before it was picked over, hastily, by looters.

betterquesting.name: Downfall
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a suit of Carapace Armor.** -The bad news is that the bunker has been looted. The good news is that whoever did it was an amateur.

pages:9.8:
I bribed some Lootenant guy with a couple packs of smokes to get the entrance code, it's 8219.
Julian

betterquesting.name: New Quests Available: Explorer
betterquesting.desc: speak with a caravan master about locations

betterquesting.name: The Rock
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the automated quarry and the nearby caravan outpost. The access code is 3275.** -The quarry is the top half of an automated mining complex, situated deep underground and powered by geothermal energy. It looks like it was designed to expel waste rock to the surface, where it could be utilized by settlers for construction. No one knows how much waste rock is down there, but the caravan masters claim you could scoop up load after load and the automated systems will just keep spitting out more.

betterquesting.name: Water Of Life
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the water pump and the nearby caravan outpost. The access code is 3275.** -The pumping station was built on top of a super-deep well that was originally dug as part of an effort to irrigate the desert. It draws from an immense limestone aquifer that sits nearly a mile underground.

betterquesting.name: When The Volcano Blows
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the active volcano near the quarry.** -The active volcano, Rutger, named in honor of the research assistant who perished while taking samples from it, allegedly connects to a sea of magma deep underground. It's been touted as a prime spot for a geothermal power plant.

betterquesting.name: Dark Medium
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the Lost & Damned vault and nearby caravan outpost. The access code is 3275.** -The caravan has an outpost near a vault that's said to house the remainder of Burke's forces.

betterquesting.name: Imperial March
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the Imperial vault and nearby caravan outpost. The access code is 3275.** -What's left of the Imperial expedition is taking shelter in a vault. The caravan has an outpost nearby, making travel convenient.

betterquesting.name: Opposites Attract
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the entrance to the Adeptus Mechanicus bunker. The access code is 8219.** -The Adeptus Mechanicus share a bunker with the caravan somewhere south of the crash site.

betterquesting.name: Ghost Mountain
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the Eerie Mesa and the nearby caravan outpost. The access code is 3275.** -The Eerie Mesa is a landmark that's regarded by the locals as haunted. The Caravan has an outpost there nonetheless.

betterquesting.name: No Blood For Oil
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the Ghawar oil field.** -According to geological surveys the planet Mortua is a cornucopia of hydrocarbons. Huge quantities of oil, coal and gas sit in pockets across just under the surface, waiting to be exploited. A large field of light, sweet crude is supposed to be near the water pump. The natives call it Ghawar, and it was being developed before the disaster struck.

betterquesting.name: The Guns Of Fort Dude
betterquesting.desc: **Locate Fort Dude.** -Fort Dude was used by Burke's forces as a fire base during the civil war. All the big guns are out of commission, but the fort still stands. The Caravan has a policy of never attempting to climb the mesa the fort sits on, alleging that the defenders never actually left, and that they still stand at their posts to this day. Whether that's true or not is up for debate, but it's almost certainly surrounded by mines.

betterquesting.name: Ghost Town
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a note.** -The ramshackle town looks like it's been empty for some time. There's no trace of it's inhabitants.

pages:9.8: take care, i love you & watch your back!                   Kelly

betterquesting.name: Something Rotten
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a note.** -The house is at the edge of town and looks like its withstood the brunt of natures fury. Searching it reveals only some rotten food and a note.

betterquesting.name: The Faithful
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a note.** -Midst a collection of rough-shod huts stands one with a single bed. Inside you find a diary page ripped out and placed on the crude bed.

betterquesting.name: Gimme Shelter
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a freezer.** -This shelter has been occupied only recently. It seems to be complete with a bed, furnace and freezer. You hope there's a few cold ones left.

betterquesting.name: Cellar Door
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some food and water.** -The old house stood alone, the winds whipping through it's bones as sand ground it's foundation to rubble. It's no surprise that the basement was used as an impromptu survival shelter, and littered across the floor are cans of food and water cells.

betterquesting.name: Junk Man
betterquesting.desc: **Sell scrap to Argus.**

betterquesting.name: Arboretum
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered saplings and seeds.** -The farm was clearly meant for trees, yet it lies fallow. Perhaps the owner never had time to plant their crop.

betterquesting.name: Secret Garden
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a cache of agricultural supplies.** -Under the dilapidated house was a spacious, modern greenhouse. It's stocked with everything you would need to grow food, or other things.

betterquesting.name: Rebel Yell
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a cache of supplies.** -The cavern, walled off from the rest of the cave system and concealed from the outside world, is an ideal hideout. It's stocked with ammo, supplies, and even machinery. This was the work of professionals, but what could have come of them?

betterquesting.name: Shadow Over Ironsmith
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some credits and food.** -As you step into the abandoned town you are overwhelmed with the smell of rotten fish. Where it's coming from is hard to say, considering Mortua has no large bodies of water, and possibly no fish. Whatever caused the residents to leave the place they seemed to have left in a hurry. Perhaps it was something to do with the awful stench.

betterquesting.name: Spider Hole
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a settler's residence.** -The home is barren of creature-comforts, and consists of a number of mismatched crates. Whoever lived here was a survivor doing whatever it takes to get by.

betterquesting.name: Den Of Iniquity
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a settlers residence.** -Concealed within an unassuming cave nestled in the sprawling wastes you find a hidden door. Inside, a well stocked room centered around a very large computer. As you move through it you hear the loud crunches of wrappers underfoot, and you notice a sprawl of empty bottles littering the corners, the remains of meals scattered sloppily about.  This is the lair of a programmer, you think, concluding the thought with a sharp nod.

betterquesting.name: Mad House
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a settler's residence.** -The shelter looks to be little more than an abandoned mineshaft and a miners shack, complete with rows of furnaces. It looks like someone turned a mineshaft into a makeshift mushroom farm.

betterquesting.name: Bachelor Pad
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a settler's residence.** -Stepping into the bunker from the wasteland is like entering a dream. Far from a mere shelter, the place is practically a palace. Judging from the looks of it and the sheer number of creature comforts you figure it to be somebodies retirement present to them self. Perhaps the alarmed looking man charging toward you can let you know who owns the place.

betterquesting.name: Fort Dudes Armory
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered Fort Dude's armory.** -In the basement of Fort Dude, past countless abominations, sits the armory that holds the forts most valuable supplies. Rummaging through the loot, coated in the coagulated blood of your deceased former comrades, you smile to yourself.

betterquesting.name: Rod Of Iron
betterquesting.desc: **Kill Richards and forge his signature.** -There's more than one way to cook an egg, and while you admit the idea is ethically fraught, a part of you can't deny that there's more at stake here than worker's rights.

betterquesting.name: A Greased Palm Never Burns
betterquesting.desc: **Bribe Richards to coax his men back to work.** -Sometimes it's just easier to throw money at a problem, and in this case the loss of skilled workers due to lead poisoning may have wider implications for the vault and the war effort.

betterquesting.name: In Dust We Trust
betterquesting.desc: **Submit Dust to the Ad-mech to raise your reputation with them. There is a 20 minute cooldown on this quest.**

betterquesting.name: Way Back Home
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain the materials to build a spaceship to escape Mortua.** -The Ad-mech have provided you with a list of supplies they require to assemble you spaceship. At first glimpse it seems unremarkable, but as you learn more about what goes into each part the challenge seems unfathomable. This will take some time, and you may be stuck on mortua with nothing but your hands and wits until then.

betterquesting.name: Emperor's Peace
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with the man at the desk.** -The immense figure cut an imposing impression against the pristine office. It seemed as if the glare from his armor would blind you, forcing you to briefly shield your eyes. A sense of familiarity came rushing back to you, and with it a sick feeling in the pit of your stomach. You knew you had to talk to him, that you had talked to him, and that this had all passed before.

betterquesting.name: Dread
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the source of the disturbing noises.** -The disturbing scene in front of you passed by as if in a blur, your mind keenly attuned to a sickening gnawing sound that chilled you to your bone. Moving through the ghoulish room as if in a dream, you strode forward, forcing every fiber of your body to move against it's grain to confront the horror that lurked just ahead.

betterquesting.name: Total Recall
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with Arbitrator Dolan and find out what's going on.** -As your mind succumbs to the sedative you feel sleep tugging at your eyelids. A gentle warmth glides over you in waves, gradually nudging you further into a deep slumber. You are enveloped in an encompassing darkness now, and just as your tenuous grasp on consciousness begins slipping away you see a beacon of light in your minds eye. It's hard to make out, but it's getting closer and gradually comes into focus; it's a manor. A sprawling estate situated in the midst of vast pine barrens. The scene is upon you now, and you notice people milling about all over the place; ex-colleagues of yours, you realize. This is a memory of a case you solved ages ago, before you'd become a Commissar, before you'd even joined the Guard, back when you were just another inspector in the Arbites of planet Caladan. You now find yourself standing inside the mansion, just as if you were actually there. Struggling to remember the details of the case, you see your old friend Arbitrator Dolan and resolve to get the answers out of him.

tasks.description: Speak with Dolan and find out what's going on.

pages:9.8: [scribbled on the side is the code 4238]

betterquesting.name: Case Closed
betterquesting.desc: **Locate and examine the body. The access code is 4238.** -Speaking with Dolan barely jarred your memory, and though you have a vague recollection of the events unfolding before your eyes it's a feeling more akin to deja vu than a real memory. The dossier on the suspect revealed some disturbing details about the mind of the killer, and you doubt that you would have simply forgotten about a case of this magnitude. The same gnawing, sinking feeling of dread that you experienced on Mortua is now leaving you racked with psychic torment. Terrible things claw at the edges of your tattered psyche, pulling at the unraveling threads and threatening to unwind you. You fear what lurks in this place, but deep down you know that the only way out of this nightmare is through it. Perhaps inspecting the suspects body will give you some idea of whether this is a hallucination or a memory, and whether your aching suspicion that the true culprit remains at large is valid.

betterquesting.name: That Feeling
betterquesting.desc: **Examine the room for more information about the alleged perpetrator.** -"I was always stressed out in the Arbites. It wasn't like being a Commissar, where I could carry out punishments on a whim, it was more suffocating. It was like I knew how the case would play out before I even read the brief. I chalked it up to instinct, of course, and brushed the notion off. There was something off, though. My damn instincts were more thorough than the entire force."

betterquesting.name: It Shall Set You Free
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the master bedroom and examine it. The access code is 336.** -The oversights of the investigators on this scene cannot be accidental. To miss such glaring details is either gross incompetence or deliberate negligence, and either is equally confounding. Though the how and why is beyond your grasp, you get the impression that someone high up doesn't want the truth to come out, and that your findings will somehow be lost in the shuffle. Fighting through the mounting tension, you struggle to compose yourself. Falling back into that worn groove of your time in the Arbites, you steel yourself and determine to follow through with the investigation the best way you know how: using your intuition. Your superiors are clearly content to lay the blame on a dead man and close the case, for whatever reason, but you deduce that more substantial evidence could make a compelling point for leaving it open.

betterquesting.name: Secrets And Lies
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the basement and find out what lurks under the Zaven mansion. The code is 849.** -You knew from your brief that the basement was a modest wine cellar, but something else was there, too. Something dark.

betterquesting.name: Dread
betterquesting.desc: **Locate the source of the disturbing noises.** -The disturbing scene in front of you passed by as if in a blur, your mind keenly attuned to a sickening gnawing sound that chilled you to your bone. Moving through the ghoulish room as if in a dream, you strode forward, forcing every fiber of your body to move against it's grain to confront the horror that lurked just ahead.

betterquesting.name: Emperor's Peace
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with the man at the desk.** -The immense figure ahead cut an imposing impression against the pristine office. It seemed as if the glare from his armor would blind you, if only you stared too long. A sense of familiarity came rushing back to you, and with it a sick feeling in the pit of your stomach. You knew you had to talk to him, that you had talked to him, and that this had all passed before.

betterquesting.name: Charon's Fall
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a grenade launcher.** -Midst the wreckage of the Charon, you spot a number of intact supplt crates. One of them, conveniently labeled "Grenade Launcher", tells you all you need to know about it's contents.

betterquesting.name: It's A Sabotage
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain a Circuit Mk.I to repair the Charon's safe and obtain page two.** -The safe is badly damaged from the impact, and it seems the electronics have been compromised. There should be a backup circuit somewhere, but only the Captain would have the inventory of that on a ship of this size.

betterquesting.name: Water For The Dying
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain water, Military Rations and a Stimpack for Leon in exchange for page three.** -It would be simple enough to kill Leon where he lay, but you'd hate to risk getting blood on the pages.

betterquesting.name: Cold, Cold Heart
betterquesting.desc: **Kill Leon and take page three.** -Killing Leon was an easy decision, and as his corpse slid down the wall and slumped over page three was revealed, having been right behind him all along.

betterquesting.name: Death And Taxes
betterquesting.desc: **Pay Wek 800 credits for page four.** -As much as it pains you to fork over your hard-earned credits to a scoundrel like Wek you see only one other obvious alternative, and it doesn't seem like it would please the guards.

betterquesting.name: Second Story Work
betterquesting.desc: **Break into Wek's house and steal page four. The code is 2239.** -You expect little resistance from Nathan, judging him to be another dimwitted slave, so your spirits run high as you walk toward Wek's house, assured in your immanent victory.

betterquesting.name: Calculated Dismissal
betterquesting.desc: **Kill Wek and take page four.** -"Wek may have been paying the guards a hefty sum to protect him, but in the end it's their boss that decides what my punishment is. Besides, I barely even hit him."

betterquesting.name: Bad Company
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain an HE Grenade for Trev in exchange for the code to Wek's apartment.** -While it may seem wrong to convince a person of Trev's intellect to assail his master with an HE grenade the thought of the look on Wek's face brings a smile to yours.

tasks.description: speak with Trev about breaking into Weks

betterquesting.name: 40 Theives
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered an ammo cache.** -Despite the apocalyptic conditions around you, you note that this bunker has seen recent, and frequent, use. Upon further inspection you find a cache of ammunition tucked in the bottom of a supply crate filled with a variety of useless consumer goods. As you search the rest of the crates you begin to notice a trend and eventually deduce that you've stumbled upon the entrance to a raider hide out, complete with an encoded, blast-proof door to some unknown quarter.

betterquesting.name: The Ninth Gate
betterquesting.desc: **Locate Roman and speak with him about the book.** -The truth of things is obvious to you now, and you no longer harbor any doubts about the powers that govern the cosmos. You know you must speak with Roman to conclude this business, but you are tempted to simply lay waste to everything in your path and take what you want. You struggle to control your impulses, and wonder if this is what power feels like.

betterquesting.name: Unlock Keeper Of Secrets
betterquesting.desc: **Unlock the ability to transform steel and flesh into gold and Dust.**

betterquesting.name: Unlock Power Overwhelming
betterquesting.desc: **Unlock the ability to transform steel, Dust and gore into bolt mags.**

betterquesting.name: Friends In Low Places
betterquesting.desc: **Buy a round for everyone in The Bloodletter. It's located on level two of the Lost & Damned vault.**

betterquesting.name: Dope Game
betterquesting.desc: **Sell chems to Cecilia. She's located in The Bloodletter, on level two of the Lost & Damned vault.**

betterquesting.name: The Last Word
betterquesting.desc: **Joon the mercenary is available for work if you're friendly with the Lost & Damned and can pay him. He's located in the Cat's Paw, on level two of the Lost & Damned vault.**

betterquesting.name: Bloodsport
betterquesting.desc: **Fight waves of mobs in the arena. It's located on level three of the Lost & Damned vault.**

betterquesting.name: The Steel Cathedral
betterquesting.desc: **Enter the Steel Cathedral once you're friendly with the Lost & Damned. It's located on level two of the Lost & Damned vault.**

betterquesting.name: Come On And Slam
betterquesting.desc: **Buy a round for everyone in the Slam Sector. It's located on level two of the Imperial vault.**

betterquesting.name: Copperhead Road
betterquesting.desc: **Sell booze to Drusky.**

betterquesting.name: Valkyrie
betterquesting.desc: **Diana the priestess is available for work if you're friendly with the Imperium and can pay her. She's located on level two of the Imperial vault.**

betterquesting.name: Wangsta
betterquesting.desc: **Sell Elysium Buds to G Unit. He's located on level two of the Imperial vault.**

betterquesting.name: Who Run Barter Town
betterquesting.desc: **Set up trade stations at "How Bazaar". It's located on level two of the Imperial vault.**

betterquesting.name: Members Only
betterquesting.desc: **Enter the Officer's Club once you're friendly with the Imperium. It's located on level two of the Imperial vault.**

betterquesting.name: New Quests Available: Noblesse Oblige
betterquesting.desc: this is triggered after talking to Vance about buying rounds for everyone in the Slam Sector

tasks.description: speak with Vance about buying rounds
speak with Sex Machine about buying rounds

betterquesting.name: Squatters Rights
betterquesting.desc: **Set up a base in one of the silos.**

betterquesting.name: Greens Keepers
betterquesting.desc: **Set up a garden in the greenhouse. It's located on level three of the Imperial vault.**

betterquesting.name: A Human Right
betterquesting.desc: **Recieve free healthcare at the clinic. It's located on level three of the Imperial vault.**

betterquesting.name: Voodoo Medicine
betterquesting.desc: **Receive free healthcare at the Eight-Fold shrine. It's located on level two of the Lost & Damned vault.**

betterquesting.name: It's Just Business
betterquesting.desc: **Set up a bank account or sell precious metals and Dust at Dagon Holdings Inc. It's located on level two of the Lost & Damned vault.**

betterquesting.name: Red Light Special
betterquesting.desc: **Buy and sell a variety of goods at the Lost & Damned market. It's located on level one of the Lost & Damned vault.**

betterquesting.name: Market Square
betterquesting.desc: **Buy and sell a variety of goods at the Imperial market. It's located on level two of the Imperial vault.**

betterquesting.name: Day Trader
betterquesting.desc: **Set up a bank account or sell precious metals and Dust at the Reuben Building. It's located on level two of the Imperial vault.**

betterquesting.name: A Noble Prince
betterquesting.desc: **Dogmeat the Warg will follow you and fight your enemies for food.** -The mangy beast is alone in this world, and a part of you knows that without your care it will die. Even a hardened, peerless killer such as yourself can barely stand the idea it, and you find yourself compelled to take it under your care.

betterquesting.name: Running On Fumes
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a cache of promethium.** -The drilling site had likely been erected to explore for oil or water. Like all commercial activity on a frontier world, the power was provided by small generators burning promethium.  A large cache of it lies next to the generator, abandoned, like much else on this world.

betterquesting.name: Crash Test Dummy
betterquesting.desc: **Crash the combat servitor is available for work if you're friendly with the Ad-Mech and can repair him. He's located in the Ad-Mech vault.**

betterquesting.name: Crypt Keeper
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain artifacts.** -"The crypts are unusual, even for this place. From what my sources say they've discovered human and alien artifacts there, lying together, seemingly from the same time period. Careful, though. I hear strange tales of the dead rising from their graves to fend off the goons I send out to die in the desert. Spoooooky."

betterquesting.name: Ancient Aliens
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain artifacts.** -"All the other artifacts have been interesting curios, but frankly speaking, these artifacts are what we really need. These objects, often depicting very strange alien imagery and indecipherable writing, somehow seem to tie everything together. With enough of them I can work toward translating the alien alphabet and finally begin to paint a picture of life in ancient Mortua."

betterquesting.name: Tomb Raider
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain artifacts.** -"The crumbling tombs scattered across this world tell me that an alien civilization once called it home. Exactly what happened to the aliens is a question that can only be answered by plumbing the depths of those old places where they laid down their dead. Search for more of these stone brick tombs, and bring me back the artifacts you find inside, and you'll be generously rewarded."

betterquesting.name: Dungeons Of The Endless
betterquesting.desc: **Obtain artifacts.** -"Most of these artifacts should be buried forever under 1000 tons of rockcrete, but they're also worth a fortune. Considering the nature of your assignment it may be wise to contemplate all the angles when it comes to dealing with warp-tainted objects. The hardline doesn't pay well, you know?"

betterquesting.name: Keeper Of The Flame
betterquesting.desc: *Locate and speak with Rezz.** -The Tech-priest instructed you to speak with one of his peers, Rezz. You find it somewhat comforting to know that even in the labyrinthine halls of the tech-worshippers Quartermasters are still a thing.

betterquesting.name: Party Bunker
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a stash of party supplies in the hidden bunker.** -The bunker is strewn with empty bottles, pill canisters and ashtrays, and the stench of burnt flowers lingers in the dank air. A number of goodies lie on the tables and floor, and you eagerly help yourself to them.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Strength
betterquesting.desc: Strength is a measure of your characters raw power. Strength affects the following: carrying capacity, melee damage, heavy weapons, melee weapons, explosives, mining and building. Complete the Checkbox Task to the right to invest a point in this stat, but you must have at least one available stat point and cannot have more than ten Strength.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Perception
betterquesting.desc: Perception is a measure of your senses and your situational awareness. Perception affects the following: accuracy with all weapons, chunk loading, and the Small Guns, Heavy Weapons, Energy Weapons, Explosives, Farming, Building, Survival and Exploring skills. Complete the Checkbox Task to the right to invest a point in this stat, but you must have at least one available stat point and cannot have more than ten Perception.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Endurance
betterquesting.desc: Endurance is a measure of your fitness level, fortitude and pain tolerance. Endurance affects the following: max health, move speed and the Mining, Farming, Survival and Exploring skills. Complete the Checkbox Task to the right to invest a point in this stat, but you must have at least one available stat point and cannot have more than ten Endurance.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Charisma
betterquesting.desc: Charisma is a measure of your charm, wit and ability to lead others. Charisma affects the following: quest rewards, settler labor bonuses and the Mayor skill. Complete the Checkbox Task to the right to invest a point in this stat, but you must have at least one available stat point and cannot have more than ten Charisma.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Intelligence
betterquesting.desc: Intelligence is a measure of your ability to absorb, retain and process information. Intelligence affects the following: skill points per level and the Farming, Building, Engineer, Medicine, Repair, Exploring and Mayor skills. Complete the Checkbox Task to the right to invest a point in this stat, but you must have at least one available stat point and cannot have more than ten Intelligence.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Agility
betterquesting.desc: Agility is a measure of your speed, dexterity and reflexes. Agility affects the following: action points, dodging, accuracy, recoil, and the Small Guns, Heavy Weapons, Energy Weapons, Melee Weapons, Engineer, Medicine and Repair skill. Complete the Checkbox Task to the right to invest a point in this stat, but you must have at least one available stat point and cannot have more than ten Agility.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Luck
betterquesting.desc: Luck is a measure of how often chance seems to favor you. Luck affects the following: random loot quantity, weapon damage and every skill. Complete the Checkbox Task to the right to invest a point in this stat, but you must have at least one available stat point and cannot have more than ten Luck.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Small Guns
betterquesting.desc: Invest a skill point into this skill to gain access to its abilities. A new ability is unlocked every ten points, and the abilities are listed to the right. Small Guns grants you access to attachments that improve the damage, accuracy, reload time and recoil compensation for all light weapons. Small Guns also gives you abilities that allow you to spend action points on ammunition for light weapons.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Heavy Weapons
betterquesting.desc: Invest a skill point into this skill to gain access to its abilities. A new ability is unlocked every ten points, and the abilities are listed to the right. Heavy Weapons grants you access to attachments that improve the damage, accuracy, reload time and recoil compensation for all portable and stationary heavy weapons. Heavy Weapons also gives you abilities that allow you to spend action points on ammunition for heavy weapons.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Energy Weapons
betterquesting.desc: Invest a skill point into this skill to gain access to its abilities. A new ability is unlocked every ten points, and the abilities are listed to the right. Energy Weapons grants you access to attachments that improve the damage, accuracy, reload time and recoil compensation for all energy weapons. Energy Weapons also gives you abilities that allow you to spend action points on ammunition for energy weapons. Finally, some abilties will allow you to periodically recharge batteries for action points.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Melee Weapons
betterquesting.desc: Invest a skill point into this skill to gain access to its abilities. A new ability is unlocked every ten points, and the abilities are listed to the right. Melee Weapons grants you access to attachments that improve the damage and handling for the following melee weapons: combat knife, ripper, chainsword, power sword, relic blades and power maul. Melee Weapons also gives you abilities that allow you to spend action points on temporary combat boosts called Martial Trances. Finally, some abilities permanently boost your melee and unarmed damage.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Explosive Weapons
betterquesting.desc: Invest a skill point into this skill to gain access to its abilities. A new ability is unlocked every ten points, and the abilities are listed to the right. Explosives grants you access to attachments that improve the damage, accuracy, reload time and recoil compensation for all explosive weapons. Explosives also gives you abilities that allow you to spend action points on grenades, satchels and ammunition for explosive weapons.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Mining
betterquesting.desc: Invest a skill point into this skill to gain access to its abilities. A new ability is unlocked every ten points, and the abilities are listed to the right. Mining grants you access to abilities that allow you to spend action points on various types of ore ranging from iron and bauxite to gold.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Farming
betterquesting.desc: Invest a skill point into this skill to gain access to its abilities. A new ability is unlocked every ten points, and the abilities are listed to the right. Farming grants you access to abilities that allow you to spend action points on seeds, produce, agricultural products and eventually fertilizer and promethium.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Building
betterquesting.desc: Invest a skill point into this skill to gain access to its abilities. A new ability is unlocked every ten points, and the abilities are listed to the right. Building grants you access to abilities that allow you to spend action points on various types of building materials ranging from planks and rockcrete to fences and landmines.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Survival
betterquesting.desc: Invest a skill point into this skill to gain access to its abilities. A new ability is unlocked every ten points, and the abilities are listed to the right. Survival grants you access to abilities that allow you to spend action points on everything you need to survive in the wasteland ranging from food and water to mob repellent and extra lives.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Engineer
betterquesting.desc: Invest a skill point into this skill to gain access to its abilities. A new ability is unlocked every ten points, and the abilities are listed to the right. Engineer grants you access to abilities that allow you to spend action points, steel and Dust on machinery and parts ranging from circuits and solar panels to batt-packs and turrets.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Medicine
betterquesting.desc: Invest a skill point into this skill to gain access to its abilities. A new ability is unlocked every ten points, and the abilities are listed to the right. Medicine grants you access to abilities that allow you to spend action points on everything you need to keep you and your allies healed and buffed ranging from healing potions and drugs to Narthecium ammo and Medicae Servo-Skulls.

betterquesting.name: Put Points In Repair
betterquesting.desc: Invest a skill point into this skill to gain access to its abilities. A new ability is unlocked every ten points, and the abilities are listed to the right. Repair grants you access to abilities that allow you to spend action points, steel and Dust on repairing your armor.

betterquesting.name: Iron And Copper
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a piece of Scout Armor.** -The comm bunker is small, and every corner and wall is lined with advanced electronics whose lights have long sat unlit. You notice a piece of Scout Armor wedged into an empty space in a server rack just as you turn to leave.

betterquesting.name: Catch A Ride
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a Scout Car.** -You can scarcely believe your eyes as you spot the car, and you are even more incredulous at the sight of a stack of fuel cans, but there it is. Your life should be a lot simpler as long as you can keep it in good condition, and if you can't there's always the Repair Tool.

betterquesting.name: Strike Out
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some whiskey and chems.** -Stuffed away in the back of the drawer, nestled neatly behind a copy of the Lectitio Divinatus, you find another book. Flipping through the pages you realize it must have been someones diary. Perhaps it could reveal something about the fate of this town.

betterquesting.name: Dark Pools
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some Duralux and steel.** -Like the rest of the houses in town, this one sits unoccupied. As you push your way in a huge dust clouds are thrown into the stale air. Scanning the interior, you gather that the house belonged to a laborer of modest means. You hope there is something salvageable as you begin to rifle through the drawers and chests.

betterquesting.name: Pumped Up
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a steel shovel.** -Inside the house, in the corner and propped up against the wall, you notice a steel shovel. The craftsmanship is superb for a simple tool on a frontier world such as this, and you begin to wonder about the true extent of these seemingly simple people's wealth.

betterquesting.name: Have You Seen Me?
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some fuel.** -Unlike the rest of the houses in town which merely presented as disused, this house seems somewhat disheveled, as if the occupant had neglected it's upkeep. Several canisters of high grade fuel are wedged under the bed in an odd looking crate. The crate seems to be missing a canister.

pages:9.8: I just wanted to scream, because Vardis was with them men, and I just know he wouldn't leave without me. I can't say nothing to mom but I think those men are dead, and I'm scared I'm next.

betterquesting.name: Just A Coincidence
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some beer.** -The dim house has a musty odor, and your eyes are immediately drawn to several broken beer bottles. As you walk through the house, glass crunching underfoot, you notice a worn, leather-bound book near a bed. Reaching down to grab it, you notice six unopened bottles of beer in the corner; they're warm, but you don't mind.

betterquesting.name: Last Words
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some ammo.** -The exterior of the house is horribly mangled, with deep gashes running across it, as if something had tried to claw it's way in. The door appears to have been ripped off it's hinges, and on the inside the walls are riddled with bullet holes. You know there was a struggle here, but it's not until you find several large patches of dried blood that you suspect the worst.

betterquesting.name: Dark Bargain
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a cache of pitchblende.** -The entities seemed to be congregating around this wing of the mine, and after prying open one of the large crates you begin to suspect the cause. It seems that this was a pitchblende, or uranium, mine, and a prosperous one at that. The townsfolk must have just uncovered this deposit before the creatures came, but the question of whether they fled or were cut down to the last remains.

betterquesting.name: Freedom Through Force
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a cache of weapons and ammo.** -A crate labeled "Fight The Power!" lies in front of you, and as you begin to open you can't help but crack a smile at the array of weapons and supplies sitting before you. These rebels were certainly well equipped, if not prepared.

betterquesting.name: Alpha Squad
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a Flamer.** -From the beds you gather that this location housed a single squad of rebels. Several journals lie about, and under one of the beds you notice the tell-tale nozzle of a Flamer.

betterquesting.name: Any Port In A Storm
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some Duralux.** -The discovery of yet another hidden base is of no surprise to you, and it's become increasingly clear that this planet was in the throes of some kind of war shortly before your arrival. The beds have been unoccupied for some time, but unclaimed supplies are plentiful.

betterquesting.name: Slim Pickins
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a Satchel.** -Stepping into the shack, you immediately note a bag on the bed. It's empty, but it looks robust enough to hold some of your supplies without tearing.

betterquesting.name: Bunker Buster
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some grenades.** -The lone bunker would have been empty if not for the animated corpse, hell bent on holding on to it's patch of land even in death. The floor is littered with trash and empty water containers, but a large crate stocked with a variety of grenades sits off in the corner, undisturbed.

betterquesting.name: Death Pit Offering
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a Ripper.** -The steel alter is crusted in dried blood, and the crimson pool before you seems like too great a volume to have come about by natural means. All around you skulls are pinned to the walls, and off to your left a passage shrouded in shadow. It seems this simple hovel was merely a front for something sinister. As you inspect the alter for more clues you notice the outline of a Ripper covered in a pile of festering gore.

betterquesting.name: Sacrificial Offerings
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some credits.** -Pushing aside the lid of a crate, you find a wealth of credits and valuables. Stopping for a moment to think, it all begins to click: the skulls, the blood, the alter, and now this, a pile of ill-gotten gains. The killer that called this place their home was prolific, and brutal. You begin to wonder what might have happened to them.

betterquesting.name: Home On The Range
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some food and water.** -The empty hovel is furnished with the usual working-class fare, but a large and well stocked bookshelf in the corner catches your eye. As you approach it you notice a row of books sticking out further than they should, and slowly tilting them out, you catch a glimpse of a number of water cells, and some rations.

betterquesting.name: Illegal Operation
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some mining supplies.** -Wildcatters, or miners without a license, exist all across Imperial space. You're not surprised to find a poorly shored up wildcat operation. You almost feel sorry for them, given they likely had to abandon the claim just as they struck coal.

betterquesting.name: Scouts Honor
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some ammo.** -The tower stood a lonesome watch over the valley ahead, and from the looks of it the guard never even left his post.

betterquesting.name: A Terrible Presence
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a cache of supplies.** -The skinless, corrupt being that was once the salvation of this town stands before you, cackling. It's muscles glistening and dripping with thickened blood, it begins to croak out words, it's voice like nails on a chalkboard. "Come to join my congregation, friend?" it rasps, "All are welcome here, lay down your arms and join us, join us in eternal peace", the creature chides as it lurches toward you menacingly. Before the rush of combat overtakes you, you notice one final feature of the dimly-lit cavern: a large heap of guns, ammo and other essentials.

betterquesting.name: On Top Of The World
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a guidance relay.**

betterquesting.name: Worldly Possessions
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a cache of valuables.** -When the creature finally fell, it was as if a veil had been lifted from your eyes. Suddenly, a hoard of glittering wealth sat before you, the collective valuables of all the people who had met their end at his hand.

betterquesting.name: World Of The Blind
betterquesting.desc: **Locate a safe place and build a Town Hall for the settlers.** A few settlers expressed an interest in following their savior, and it's too hard to say no. It'll take some basic supplies and a secure building but these hardy folk are able to live just about anywhere. The first step toward building a new settlement is placing the Town Hall, where various things can be configured, and where work is ordered.                                        The Town Hall must be placed in a secure space, and it can be placed by right-clicking a block with the Town Hall beacon. Make sure the area chosen area is desirable, because the Town Hall can't be relocated once placed. After placing the town hall, place the settlers. They will pitch in and help you out by completing basic activities, but they'll only do so much each day unless they're provided for.                                                    Try and talk with each settler every day to obtain your free labor, and complete their needs quests at your discretion to gain even more. Players with high Charisma benefit more from needs quests, and everyone benefits from the free, daily labor. To gain access to more settlers, merchants and your own private security force, you'll need to invest points in the Mayor skill.

betterquesting.name: High Plains Drifter
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a guidance relay.**

betterquesting.name: Swampwatch Point
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a guidance relay.**

betterquesting.name: Subsistence Farming
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a cache of farming supplies.** -Having stumbled up a simple farmhouse, you hope to find some kind of supply cache - food, water maybe even a few rounds of ammo. Instead, you discover a large cache of farming supplies; everything you would need to work the land and get your food the old fashioned way. You shudder at the thought.

betterquesting.name: Hostile Territory
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a guidance relay.**

betterquesting.name: Keeper Of The Flame
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a guidance relay.**

betterquesting.name: A Beautiful Mind
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with Phaser.** -The skittish woman seems unable to focus, and her eyes flick back and forth rapidly, endlessly scanning the room. You wonder what she's looking for.

betterquesting.name: Too Old For This Shit
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with Adam.** -The man eyes you suspiciously, but seems eager to talk with something that can talk back.

betterquesting.name: Man On The Run
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with Keybiss.** -The man standing before you looks badly injured. His cloths are torn and there is a desperate, animal look to his eyes. You figure he's on the run, from whom is anyone's best guess. The possibility of working together for survival comes to mind.

betterquesting.name: Cogitator Wizard
betterquesting.desc: **Speak with Deanar.** -The settler looks up at you, shielding his eyes from the light leaking in behind you. The man squints hard as you move toward him, making plaintive gestures and mumbling wearily, backpedaling to give himself space.

betterquesting.name: Hidden Valley
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered supplies.** -Nestled in the valley lie a small farm situated next to a house carved into the cliff face. Inside, you find a well-stocked supply cabinet and a number of beds. You consider the possibility of staying here, where at the least you have a solid door and four walls to protect you.

betterquesting.name: Sunken Temple
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered gold ingots.** -The cave seems to have an atmosphere of it's own, and the skulls and haunting, otherworldly glyphs that line that walls of the place indicate that it's a site of significance for these creatures. Counting the skulls, you figure that the number roughly matches up to the number of people who lived in the town. As a sinking feeling begins to set in you notice a glimmer of light out of the corner of your eye. Pulling aside a tarp made from a sort of leather you're not familiar with, you find yourself starting at rows of gold ingots.
