betterquesting.name: How The Mighty Fall: RF
betterquesting.desc: **You have a set number of lives and if you lose them all you will be locked out of the map. To gain more lives you must submit a charged Flux Capacitors worth 1.2 million RF.** -You are now registered with the teleportorium. If you're near death you will be teleported to safety, and you will even keep all your belongings. However, this costs the teleportorium. If the energy isn't replaced, you'll be allowed to die and be locked out of the map! To keep it charged, you submit 1.2 million worth of RF through this quest. In return you will receive the Acknowledge Network Prompt item. You must use that item to gain your life. Your lives are listed on the front page of your cogitator. Keep an eye on them, because if you run out you will be locked out of the map! Keep in mind that a Flux Capacitor needs charged in specific types of generators. You start with ten lives, so use those lives wisely and focus on getting generators and some fuel as soon as possible. Good luck!

betterquesting.desc: -Use ability.

betterquesting.name: Notepad Double-Plus Good
betterquesting.desc: **Access a sign or book.** -Coming up with something to write things down on is usually very simple, it just takes a little time.

betterquesting.name: The Essentials
betterquesting.desc: **Buy food and water from Ellie.**

betterquesting.name: Guns 'n Ammo
betterquesting.desc: **Buy guns and ammo from Varnak and Felicia.**

betterquesting.name: Mayor 30
betterquesting.desc: A score of 30 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Airwalk
betterquesting.desc: **Leap across the platforms.** -Suspended in midair by some unknown force are a number of steel platforms. They're arranged far enough apart that jumping your way across would be challenging. The factor that complicates the whole affair the most, though, is the lake of lava 25 meters below the whole thing. You suspect a fall would certainly be fatal.

betterquesting.name: Brutalizer
betterquesting.desc: **Sneak or fight through the temple.** -The temple is shrouded in darkness, with fingers of light gently grasping at the openings. Inside, you can make out the outline of robes and daggers. Is this what becomes of those who fail? You figure there's two ways through: rip and tear, or sneak right by.

betterquesting.name: Septic Shock
betterquesting.desc: **Jump into the spring water.** -With no choice but to press forward you mutter a few choice words about the situation and take a step forward. You have a vague sensation that danger lay ahead, but feel confident regardless.

betterquesting.name: The Big Boss
betterquesting.desc: **Kill the Dungeon Master.** -You were not warned of any final confrontation, but being genre savvy, you know this sentence has to end with an exclamation mark. Get ready.

betterquesting.name: Mayor 40
betterquesting.desc: A score of 40 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Mayor 50
betterquesting.desc: A score of 50 gives access to an ability.

betterquesting.name: Toolbag
betterquesting.desc: **Access tools.** -Only a fool would leave home without all the tools they would need to build a civilization from nothing.

betterquesting.name: Friends On High
betterquesting.desc: **Access Companion Beacons.** -The Companion Beacon lets you store NPC's you have hired or commanded in an item form. Simply right-click the NPC with a beacon after they have been hired or commanded to store them. You can later right-click the ground with the beacon to bring that NPC into the world. NPC's stored in beacons lose their hired or commanded status, something you should keep in mind when dealing with mercenary followers who often have very cheap single day follow options to offset this unwanted feature.

betterquesting.name: Camel Back
betterquesting.desc: **Access a Camel Pack.** -The camel pack stores water and lets you drink as needed. It is an automatic process, but you do have to refill your camel pack periodically. You can attach it to any piece of chest armor and refill it by crafting it with a water bottle.

betterquesting.name: Aura Of Authority
betterquesting.desc: **Access Command Tokens.** -In the eyes of everyone you meet on Mortua who's in the know, you're a Colonel-Commissar, first and foremost. As such, you're a graduate of the Schola Progenium, a veteran of a thousand battles, the hero of a galaxy-spanning campaign, and a ruthless killer. People know you before you even walk in the room, and they either respect or fear you enough to do what you say, or at least get out of your way. Well, some of them, that is.

betterquesting.name: Tweaker
betterquesting.desc: **Store a gun mod table.** -Gun mods range from skill-related attachments to bayonets and scopes. Keep a table with you at all times to swap them in or out at your convenience.

betterquesting.name: Human Waves
betterquesting.desc: **Access flak armor once an hour.** -Having worked with flak armor all your life you know enough about it to salvage broken pieces and sometimes even create new ones. You can only do this every so often due to the time needed to collect all the required materials.

betterquesting.name: High Energy
betterquesting.desc: **Access a Stim Pack once per hour.** -Like most of the Imperium's soldiers, you've come to rely on the trusty Stim Pack. It heals and extends your life, often times saving you from death. You're usually able to find them lying around wherever there's an Imperial presence, but hunting them down takes time.

betterquesting.name: Charged And Ready
betterquesting.desc: **Access an EC Pack once an hour.** -The Lasgun is a woefully inadequate weapon unless deployed en masse. Despite your awareness of this fact, you continue to employ best practices while dealing with EC packs, and your diligence allows you to periodically save and salvage them.

betterquesting.name: Pavlov's EC Pack
betterquesting.desc: **Exchange a dying EC pack for a fresh one.** -It doesn't matter if it's one shot away from being spent, you can refill it here. You can also refill it the normal way, with an energy crystal. Later on, this will save you the time and expense of making new EC packs. Get in the habit of saving them now. For your troubles, you'll also receive some Duralux, which can be used to repair your armor.

betterquesting.name: Bare Necessities
betterquesting.desc: **Access food and water once an hour.** -Scraping by on meager rations is one thing, but digging through garbage and desperately scouring every nook and cranny for food and water is a new low for you. You can usually get enough to eat and drink, assuming you have enough time to look around.

betterquesting.name: Forged Memories
betterquesting.desc: **Access a Recall Beacon once an hour.** -You could have sworn that thing was charged just a moment ago. Wait, there it is.

betterquesting.name: Mountain Home
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a Mining Drill.** -The home was clearly constructed by an experienced miner, and judging by various carvings and bas reliefs they held an unusual fascination with cheese. Given the dangers inherent in delving the pitch black caves of Mortua you suspect the inhabitant came to a grisly end.

betterquesting.name: Scrap Hunter
betterquesting.desc: **Retrieve raw materials for the Dark-Mech.** -It seems the Dark-Mech's production capabilities outstrip their ability to procure scrap, and as such they're facing shortages of steel, copper and quartz. They're requesting that you go out into the wasteland and find some sources of ore, quartz and scrap, secure the areas, and bring back some samples. Seth has provided you with three sets of coordinates; they're labeled "steel scrap", "copper mine" and "natural quartz". It seems you might have to get your hands dirty for this, and at that you feel slighted. You briefly consider that they're on to you, and that this is just some humiliating fools errand, but you decide to go along, regardless. It's not as if you have a choice.

betterquesting.name: Conductive Aspirations
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some copper ore.** The mines primary shaft must have just been sunk when the cataclysm hit, and now there's no one left to finish the job. Unclaimed Chalcopyrite, or copper ore, samples lie in the steel crates scattered around the gravel drive, waiting for a geologist who will never come.

betterquesting.name: Down At The Burnpit
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some steel, promethium and beer.** -In backwater trailer parks such as this it's not uncommon to find the locals shooting the breeze over a nice trash fire. It seems whoever was on burn duty must have forgotten more than their cooler before stumbling home for the night.

betterquesting.name: Geocache
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered some quartz, military rations and whiskey.** -The shack is a bit cramped, but otherwise rather well-kept; someone even left the light on. As you rifle though the drawers you find an unopened package of military rations, and digging a little deeper a bottle of whiskey. You hold up the amber colored liquid to the light and admire it for a moment before something catches your eye. A bundle of quartz, it seems, wrapped in burlap. Funny how things work out sometimes.

betterquesting.name: Illuminated One
betterquesting.desc: **Gather the materials for a Powered Lamp.** -"Now that you have a means of generating power I feel obligated to let you in on a secret: those beasts may seem to appear from nowhere, but it's quite clear that they have some sort of aversion to light. They often fail to materialize during the day, or in the presence of especially bright artificial light, something that can be used to your advantage. Now, other that a spotlight, the brightest lamps you can build are the variety which need an external source of power. I'll make one for you and I'll even throw in some wire, free of charge. All you need to do to activate the light is to hook a wire directly to it and provide it with electricity; you don't need to put a wire connector on the light, in fact, it won't even work that way. While inefficient as far as actual an actual light source goes, they seem to keep the beasts from appearing in an area that is around 32 by 32 meters. Combined with some walls, a reinforced door and eternal vigilance you should be able to carve out a safe space for yourself, out there in the wastes."

betterquesting.name: Silver Tongued Devil
betterquesting.desc: **Convince Gyx to let you skip the temple.** -Gyx is a wizened sage, learned in the ways of the arcane and mystical, with a grasp of ideas that would break a lesser persons's mind. Surely, a great thinker such as this would appreciate a well-delivered argument on the merits of making haste with your quest to discover the truth.

tasks.description: Convince Gyx to let you skip the temple.

betterquesting.name: Hate Speech
betterquesting.desc: **Convince Deeana's followers to turn on her.** -Sometimes words can be powerful weapons. Noble words can inspire, and lift weary souls to dizzy heights; dark words can poison and wound, turning the ignorant into mindless fiends and warping beloved friends into bitter enemies.

tasks.description: Convince Deeana's followers to turn on her.

betterquesting.name: Machine Whisperer
betterquesting.desc: **Find another solution to the problem.** -Given the choices presented, no options seemed tenable. Fortunately, honesty and charm were weapons just as potent as any bolt.

tasks.description: Speak with Endel to find an alternative solution.

betterquesting.name: Untitled 7
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a guidance relay.**

betterquesting.name: Untitled 1 Sm
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a guidance relay.**

betterquesting.name: Untitled 2 Lg
betterquesting.desc: **You discovered a guidance relay.**

betterquesting.name: Forbidden Planet
betterquesting.desc: "I knew the moment command brought up the Inquisition that I was in for hell. They couldn't let me get away with insulting an Inquisitor like that, and this assignment is my punishment. Here I am, hurtling through the void toward some bloody death world near the Eye, when I should be back home, doing nothing at all! Another thing: it'll be a cold day in hell when I stoop to coddling a bunch of hapless settlers. Whatever's going on is getting sorted out real fast, and then I'm gone."

betterquesting.name: Chaos Rising
betterquesting.desc: "I can't quite put my finger on it, but something is very wrong here. Everything seems unsettling, and a lingering sense of dread hangs in the air. It's a feeling in my chest; a heaviness, like I'm sinking or choking for breath. The landscape itself is an endless, twisted alien hellscape, and the wind carries eerie sounds that echo through the recesses of my mind. I hope that the fleeting sense of some unseen presence lurking nearby is just the product of a sleep-deprived imagination, but the cries echoing up from the fissures seem to challenge that assumption. Whatever's going on, I have a sinking feeling that being caught outside at night would be a death sentence."

betterquesting.name: Ab Initio
betterquesting.desc: "The entire way here one thought's been gnawing at my mind: turn back, leave, go AWOL. I'll settle on some lush, backwater planet and just live out my life in peace. I dreaded the thought of this place, and now that I'm seeing it the feeling is so much worse. I've endured too many nightmares already, and I fear this is my last, one way or another. My only chance at sanity may be finding a way off this hell world."

betterquesting.name: Noblesse Oblige
betterquesting.desc: "There has to be some Imperial presence on this sand-ball. It isn't possible that out of all the colonists sent here a few haven't managed to eke out some kind of existence, even midst this turmoil."

betterquesting.name: Explorer
betterquesting.desc: "Keeping track of where I've been and what happened there may be a good idea."

betterquesting.name: Character Sheet
betterquesting.desc: This page is where you can view and edit your stats, traits, skills and perks. It also contains the abilities that are unlocked by your skills.
